</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	movements and reduced control over voluntary movements.&nbsp;&nbsp;We estimate that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2011
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	260,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Parkinson&#x2019;s disease patients in the United States
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	suffered from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	motor complications
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	as a result of levodopa therapy and approximately 140,000 of these patients suffered from LID
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;There are no drugs for the treatment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	LID that have been approved for marketing in the United States or Europe.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As a result, c
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	linicians typically manage LID by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	decreasing the dose of levodopa, which can exacerbate symptoms of the underlying Parkinson&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	disease.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In April 2015, the FDA granted orphan drug status to ADS-5102 for the treatment of LID associated with Parkinson's disease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In our Phase 2/3 clinical study
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, EASED, completed in June 2013,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 met its primary endpoint, reduction of LID, and several key secondary endpoints.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Subsequently, we initiated two confirmatory Phase 3 trials and a separate open-label safety study in 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We completed enrollment in the larger of these trials, EASE LID, in July 2015, and the smaller, EASE LID 3, in December 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In December 2015, w
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	e announced top-line results of EASE LID
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, in which we met our primary and all key secondary endpoints,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and expect to announce top-line results of EASE LID 3 in the first half of 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The EASE LID study enrolled 126 Parkinson&#x2019;s disease patients, who were randomized in a 1:1 ratio to the two treatment groups: placebo and 340 mg ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102.&nbsp;&nbsp;The top-line results of the study showed a statistically significant reduction (p = 0.0009) in LID at 12 weeks for patients who received ADS-5102 versus placebo as assessed by the Unified Dyskinesia Rating Scale (UDysRS).&nbsp;&nbsp;This represents a 23% reduction in LID for ADS-5102-treated patients compared to placebo.&nbsp;&nbsp;The reduction in LID was maintained at 24 weeks (p = 0.0008), a key secondary analysis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	There were four additional key secondary analyses based on patient diary data and all achieved statistical significance.&nbsp;&nbsp;Notably, at week 12, ADS-5102 significantly increased ON time without troublesome dyskinesia by 2.7 hours versus placebo and reduced OFF time by 0.9 hours.&nbsp;&nbsp;These effects were maintained at week 24.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The reported adverse events associated with ADS-5102 were consistent with the known safety profile of amantadine as well as the safety results from our earlier placebo-controlled trial.&nbsp;&nbsp;The most common adverse events (occurring in at least five percent of ADS-5102-treated patients) were: hallucinations, peripheral edema, dizziness, dry mouth, constipation, falls, urinary tract infections, anxiety, contusion, livedo reticularis, abnormal dreams, depression and headaches.&nbsp;&nbsp;Four subjects discontinued treatment due to adverse events in the placebo group versus 13 in the ADS-5102 group.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We expect to submit an NDA to the FDA for ADS-5102 for the treatment of LID in 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Overview of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease and LID
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Parkinson&#x2019;s disease is a chronic, progressive motor disorder that causes tremors, rigidity, slowed movements, and postural instability.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Parkinson&#x2019;s Disease Foundation estimates that there were approximately one million people living with Parkinson&#x2019;s disease in the United States in 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Prevalence of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease increases with age, with approximately 1.6% of people 65&nbsp;years old or older having the disease compared with 0.3% of people in the general population.&nbsp;&nbsp;As the U.S. population ages, the number of people living with Parkinson&#x2019;s disease in the United States is expected to grow at approximately 3% per year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The most commonly prescribed treatments for Parkinson&#x2019;s disease are levodopa
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based therapies.&nbsp;&nbsp;Levodopa is converted to dopamine in the body to replace the dopamine loss caused by the disease.&nbsp;&nbsp;Levodopa is generally effective in providing at least partial relief from the symptoms of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease, but fails to modify the underlying disease process.&nbsp;&nbsp;Patients initially take levodopa therapy approximately three times daily and receive relief from symptoms of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease for much of the day.&nbsp;&nbsp;This period of relief is known as ON time.&nbsp;&nbsp;As the effects of levodopa wear off, the symptoms of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease return.&nbsp;&nbsp;This is known as OFF time.&nbsp;&nbsp;By properly managing the timing of levodopa administration, patients with early stage Parkinson&#x2019;s disease can largely avoid OFF time during the day.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The table below defines the various terms that are used to describe the fluctuating symptoms of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_5"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 100.00%;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:27.44%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.72%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:69.84%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:27.44%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 7.2PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;TEXT-INDENT: -7.2PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Term
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.72%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:69.84%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Definition
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:27.44%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ON time
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.72%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:69.84%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ON time refers to periods of adequate control of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease symptoms.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:27.44%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	OFF time
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.72%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:69.84%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	OFF time refers to periods of the day when medication is not working well, causing return of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease symptoms.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:27.44%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Dyskinesia
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.72%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:69.84%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Involuntary twisting, turning movements and loss of control of voluntary movements.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:27.44%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	LID
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.72%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:69.84%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Levodopa induced dyskinesia, which is a side effect of administration of levodopa and occurs during ON time.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:27.44%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Troublesome LID
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.72%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:69.84%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	LID that interferes with the patient&#x2019;s daily function or causes meaningful discomfort.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:27.44%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ON with troublesome LID
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.72%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:69.84%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Periods of adequate control of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease symptoms but with troublesome LID.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:27.44%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ON without troublesome LID
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.72%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:69.84%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:106.67%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Periods of adequate control of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease symptoms without troublesome LID.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Over time, as Parkinson&#x2019;s disease progresses and dopaminergic neurons further degenerate, most patients require increasing doses of levodopa to achieve equivalent therapeutic benefit.&nbsp;&nbsp;Even with increased doses of levodopa, patients may begin to exhibit unpredictable OFF episodes throughout the day.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the later stages of the disease, many patients will suffer from LID.&nbsp;&nbsp;Patients with LID suffer from involuntary non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;purposeful movements and reduced control over voluntary movements.&nbsp;&nbsp;The cause of LID is unknown, but it is associated with the pulsatile administration of levodopa treatment, degeneration of key brain structures, the duration of levodopa treatment, total levodopa exposure, and other factors.&nbsp;&nbsp;LID can become severely disabling, rendering patients unable to perform routine daily tasks and increasing their risk of falling and social isolation.&nbsp;&nbsp;As Parkinson&#x2019;s disease progresses, the symptoms of LID worsen in frequency and severity.&nbsp;&nbsp;Eventually the total time that a patient spends either OFF or ON with troublesome LID can become a significant portion of his or her day.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, many Parkinson&#x2019;s disease patients at this stage have difficulty swallowing solid food or pills.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The chart below illustrates the fluctuating symptoms that an early and a late stage Parkinson&#x2019;s disease patient may experience during a two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose cycle of levodopa taken during a portion of the waking hours.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/02/23/0001558370-16-003389_ADMS20151231X10K002.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 7IN; HEIGHT: 2.251389IN" ALT="PICTURE 4">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	LID can be managed by decreasing the amount of levodopa administered to a patient, but this change can result in an increase in OFF time and a decrease in ON time.&nbsp;&nbsp;Many patients would rather endure periodic episodes of LID than face unpredictable OFF episodes.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, these patients will choose to maintain their dose of levodopa even though they will experience times when they are ON but suffering from troublesome LID.&nbsp;&nbsp;We estimate that half of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease patients in the United States develop motor complications within five years of initiating levodopa therapy, and approximately 70% of these patients suffer from LID.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Limitations of existing Parkinson&#x2019;s treatments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	There are currently no medications that are approved for marketing in the United States or Europe for the treatment of LID, a motor complication associated with use of the levodopa
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based therapies.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, clinicians sometimes attempt to manage LID with existing Parkinson&#x2019;s disease products designed to increase the levels of dopamine activity in the brain.&nbsp;&nbsp;Examples include Azilect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(Teva), Requip XL&#x2122; (GSK), Mirapex ER&#x2122; (BI), Neupro
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Patch (UCB), Comtan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(Novartis), Duopa&#x2122; (Abbvie), and Rytary&#x2122; (IMPAX).&nbsp;&nbsp;These Parkinson&#x2019;s therapies produce clinically relevant reductions in OFF time ranging from 0.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;1.9&nbsp;hours, which mostly translate into increases in ON time without troublesome LID.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, none of these products reduce LID and some actually increase LID.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Physicians may also attempt to use the immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release form of amantadine to treat LID, even though it is only approved for the treatment of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease, and not LID specifically.&nbsp;&nbsp;This approach is supported by a number of investigator
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;initiated clinical studies and case studies, which suggest that it may be effective for the treatment of LID.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, these studies were not well
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;controlled clinical trials that meet evidence
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based clinical or regulatory standards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition to the limited data regarding its effectiveness, we believe that the use of the immediate-release form of amantadine to treat LID has also been limited by potential side effects at dose levels considered to be effective.&nbsp;&nbsp;The majority of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease patients tolerate twice
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;daily dosing of 100 mg of amantadine, but often this dosing regimen is insufficient to provide adequate symptom relief.&nbsp;&nbsp;The available literature on amantadine for the treatment of LID indicates that higher doses of amantadine produce a greater reduction in LID symptoms.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, the increased frequency of adverse events at higher doses, in particular CNS events and sleep disturbances, generally limits the use of amantadine at doses greater than 200 mg per day.&nbsp;&nbsp;Immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release versions of amantadine are absorbed relatively rapidly by the body with peak concentrations in the blood being reached two to four hours after administration.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe that the side effects associated with immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release amantadine are associated with this rapid rise in concentration within a few hours after dosing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The Adamas Solution&#x2014;ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;5102
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 is a controlled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release version of amantadine that addresses many of the limitations of immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release amantadine by allowing higher daily doses of amantadine to be administered
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	once
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;daily
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	at bedtime without a significant increase in side effects.&nbsp;&nbsp;In patients taking ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102, the amantadine plasma concentration achieved in the early morning through mid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;day is estimated to be approximately two times that reached following administration of immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release amantadine, providing symptomatic relief to patients as they engage in their daily activities.&nbsp;&nbsp;Further, the lower concentrations occur in the evening, reducing the potential negative impact of amantadine&#x2019;s sleep
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;related side effects.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 capsules can be opened to sprinkle the contents on food for use by Parkinson&#x2019;s disease patients who have difficulty swallowing due to their illness.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;5102 Phase&nbsp;1 data&#x2014;pharmacokinetic profile
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our development of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 was driven by the discovery that the side effects of amantadine are not caused solely by the absolute levels of amantadine in the blood, but rather by the speed at which the maximum concentrations are reached.&nbsp;&nbsp;Immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release amantadine is rapidly absorbed by the body, with its maximum concentration in the blood being reached in two to four hours.&nbsp;&nbsp;This rapid increase in blood concentration levels is associated with an increased level of CNS side effects.&nbsp;&nbsp;In contrast, the same amount of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 is absorbed more slowly with the maximum concentration being achieved many hours later.&nbsp;&nbsp;This slower increase in blood concentration levels is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	believed to be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	associated with fewer CNS side effects than a more rapid one.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Because of this improved tolerability due to the novel pharmacokinetic profile, we were able to investigate ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 in clinical studies at dose strengths from 1.3 to 2.1 times greater than the 100 mg twice
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;daily dose typically used with immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release amantadine.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Based on our clinical experience, we are developing a 340 mg dose of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209; 5102 to be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	taken once
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	daily at bedtime.&nbsp;&nbsp;With this regimen, highest amantadine plasma concentration would be achieved from the early morning through mid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;day, providing relief to patients as they engage in their daily activities, and the lowest concentrations would occur in the evening, reducing the potential for sleep
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;related side effects.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have completed ten Phase&nbsp;1 pharmacokinetic studies in healthy subjects with two controlled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release versions of amantadine having slightly different release rates.&nbsp;&nbsp;The most frequently occurring adverse events reported in the Phase&nbsp;1 studies were headache, fatigue, and dizziness, occurring in 5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;10% of subjects, and the majority of adverse events were categorized as mild.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;5102 Phase 2/3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	(EASED Study)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In 2013, we completed a successful Phase 2/3 clinical trial of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 for the treatment of LID.&nbsp;&nbsp;This trial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, called EASED,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was designed to investigate the safety and efficacy of three dose levels of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	administered once
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	daily at bedtime
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for the treatment of LID in Parkinson&#x2019;s disease.&nbsp;&nbsp;The study enrolled 83 Parkinson&#x2019;s disease patients, who were randomized in a 1:1:1:1 ratio to the four treatment groups: placebo, 260 mg ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102, 340 mg ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102, and 420 mg ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The chart below shows the change in the Unified Dyskinesia Rating Scale, or UDysRS, score for each group in the EASED study.&nbsp;&nbsp;Both the 340 mg and 420 mg dose levels significantly reduced LID as measured by the change in the UDysRS total score over eight weeks versus placebo, meeting the primary endpoint for the clinical study (p=0.005 and p=0.013, respectively).&nbsp;&nbsp;The magnitude of the change for the 340 mg ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 group was a 43% reduction versus baseline and a 27% reduction versus placebo.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/02/23/0001558370-16-003389_ADMS20151231X10K003.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 5.51IN; HEIGHT: 3.84IN" ALT="PICTURE 3">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition, ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 significantly increased ON time without troublesome LID at the 260 mg, 340 mg, and 420 mg dose levels from baseline to week eight relative to placebo by 3.3, 3.0 and 2.7&nbsp;hours per day, respectively, as measured by patient diaries after eight weeks of treatment (least square means, p=0.004, p=0.008 and p=0.018, respectively).&nbsp;&nbsp;At the 340 mg dose level, OFF time was reduced by 0.9&nbsp;hours per day from baseline relative to placebo after 8&nbsp;weeks of treatment, though this latter result was not statistically significant (p=0.199).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Based on analysis of the pharmacokinetic, safety, and efficacy data from the Phase 2/3 study, we selected 340 mg ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5102 taken once
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	daily at bedtime
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	as the recommended dose regimen and are using that dose in our ongoing Phase&nbsp;3 trials.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe that this dose offers the best benefit/risk ratio of the doses we have studied.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Treatment with ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 did not result in worsening of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease symptoms, as measured by the MDS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;UPDRS combined score, a standard measurement of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease related disability.&nbsp;&nbsp;The adverse events reported in this study were typically mild to moderate in severity and consistent with Parkinson&#x2019;s disease and the known amantadine adverse event profile.&nbsp;&nbsp;Five patients had serious adverse events.&nbsp;&nbsp;The most common adverse events,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	occurring in more than 10% of the subjects or by more than two subjects in any ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 group, were constipation, dizziness, hallucination, dry mouth, fall, confusional state, headache, nausea, and asthenia.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;5102 Phase&nbsp;3 trials for LID
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EASE LID was initiated in June 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;In July 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the study completed enrollment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	126
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	subjects in a 26
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;week multi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;center, randomized, double
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;blind, placebo
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;controlled study assessing the efficacy of a 340 mg dose of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 administered once daily at bedtime for the treatment of LID in individuals with Parkinson&#x2019;s disease.&nbsp;&nbsp;The primary endpoint of this study
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a reduction in LID as assessed at 12&nbsp;weeks by changes in the Unified Dyskinesia Rating Scale (UDysRS) along with supporting data from secondary endpoints.&nbsp;&nbsp;The secondary endpoints include changes in the UDysRS as assessed at 24&nbsp;weeks, ON time without troublesome dyskinesia and OFF time based on home diaries, the Unified Parkinson&#x2019;s Disease Rating Scale (MDS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;UPDRS), and th
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e clinician&#x2019;s global impression of change in overall Parkinson&#x2019;s disease symptoms
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EASE LID 2 is an open label safety study
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was initiated in July 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;The study is pl
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	anned to enroll approximately 25
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0 subjects in a 52
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;week trial.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EASE LID 3 was initiated in October 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;In December 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the study completed enrollment of 77&nbsp;subjects in a 13
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;week multi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;center, randomized, double
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209; blind, placebo
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;controlled study assessing the efficacy of a 340 mg dose of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 administered once daily at bedtime for the treatment of LID in individuals with Parkinson&#x2019;s disease.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The primary endpoint of this study is a reduction in LID as assessed at 12&nbsp;weeks by changes in the Unified Dyskinesia Rating Scale (UDysRS) along with supporting data from secondary endpoints, which includes changes in ON time without troublesome dyskinesia and OFF time based on home diaries
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, the Unified Parkinson&#x2019;s Disease Rating Scale (MDS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;UPDRS), and the clinician&#x2019;s global impression of change in overall Parkinson&#x2019;s disease symptoms
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Phase 3 data (EASE LID Study)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We announced results from the EASE LID study in December 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;The study showed a statistically significant reduction (p = 0.0009) in LID at 12 weeks for patients who received ADS-5102 versus placebo as assessed by the Unified Dyskinesia Rating Scale (UDysRS).&nbsp;&nbsp;The reduction in LID was maintained at 24 weeks (p = 0.0008), a key secondary analysis.&nbsp;&nbsp;The time profile of the change in UDysRS score is shown below, indicating that the effect is seen at the first post-baseline visit at week 2, and is maintained through week 24.&nbsp;&nbsp;The placebo corrected percentage change in UDysRS at week 12 is 23%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/02/23/0001558370-16-003389_ADMS20151231X10K004.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 5.41IN; HEIGHT: 3.61IN" ALT="PICTURE 6">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	11
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage14"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The patient diary secondary outcome measures also achieved statistical significance.&nbsp;&nbsp;Notably, at week 12, ADS-5102 significantly increased ON time without troublesome dyskinesia by 2.7 hours versus placebo and reduced OFF time by 0.9 hours.&nbsp;&nbsp;These effects were maintained at week 24.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_6"></A>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
