</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Finally, for the pre-specified population of subjects who contributed PD diary data at baseline and week 12, a synchronized time profile diary analysis was generated as shown below.&nbsp;&nbsp;These graphs elucidate the complex and dynamic pattern of motor complications over the course of a day for clinical trial subjects in the EASE LID study.&nbsp;&nbsp;Subjects awaken primarily in the OFF state, followed by ON without troublesome LID, and then by variable episodes of OFF and ON with troublesome LID.&nbsp;&nbsp;In this analysis, ADS-5102 treatment improved the quality of ON time by increasing ON time without troublesome LID from morning to late afternoon and evening hours, as well as reducing the OFF time during the day.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/02/23/0001558370-16-003389_ADMS20151231X10K005.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 6.75IN; HEIGHT: 3.791667IN" ALT="PICTURE 7">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The reported adverse events associated with ADS-5102 were consistent with the known safety profile of amantadine as well as the safety results from our earlier placebo-controlled trial.&nbsp;&nbsp;The most common adverse events (occurring in at least five percent of ADS-5102-treated patients) were: hallucinations, peripheral edema, dizziness, dry mouth, constipation, falls, urinary tract infections, anxiety, contusion, livedo reticularis, abnormal dreams, depression and headaches.&nbsp;&nbsp;Four subjects discontinued treatment due to adverse events in the placebo group versus 13 in the ADS-5102 group.&nbsp;&nbsp;There were 17 subjects who experienced severe adverse events, four in the placebo group and 13 in the ADS-5102 group.&nbsp;&nbsp;Of these, one subject in the placebo group and three subjects in the ADS-5102 group had an event assessed to be study drug related.&nbsp;&nbsp;There were 10 subjects who experienced serious adverse events, three subjects in the placebo group and seven subjects in the ADS-5102 group.&nbsp;&nbsp;None of the serious adverse events were assessed to be study drug related.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We expect to submit an NDA to the FDA for ADS-5102 for the treatment of LID in 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage15"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Commercialization plan for ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;5102 in LID
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We intend to commercialize ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 in the United States, subject to FDA approval, by developing our own sales force and in other markets through distribution agreements and collaborations with CNS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;focused pharmaceutical companies.&nbsp;&nbsp;We plan to focus our commercial efforts on the approximately 4,000 neurologists and movement disorder specialists in the United States who are responsible for the treatment of greater than 60% of the patients with late-stage Parkinson&#x2019;s disease.&nbsp;&nbsp;As these physician specialists are heavily concentrated in major urban markets, we believe an approximately 30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to 60 member sales force will
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	provide adequate reach and frequency of communication for successful commercialization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We will be responsible for negotiating coverage, reimbursement, and formulary placement decisions for ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 in the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe that if ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 is approved as the first product indicated in the United States for the treatment of LID, most payers are likely to extend coverage to it and that its placement on payer formularies and the amount of reimbursement will be influenced by the availability and pricing of branded treatments for symptoms of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease, branded treatments for other forms of dyskinesia, generic amantadine, and surgical treatments for symptoms of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We intend to hold a pre-NDA meeting with the FDA to determine the contents of the NDA submission for ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we intend to meet with regulators in certain markets outside the United States to determine the regulatory pathways for access to those markets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	ADS-5102 for major symptoms associated with multiple sclerosis in patients with walking impairment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Amantadine has shown promising results in several other CNS indications, and in May 2015 we initiated a Phase 2 study of ADS-5102 for the treatment of major symptoms associated with multiple sclerosis in patients with walking impairment.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We selected multiple sclerosis as the second target indication for ADS-5102 based on observations from small investigator-sponsored trials with immediate-release amantadine in Parkinson's disease and multiple sclerosis, which suggest improvement in symptoms, encouraging data from Adamas'
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	preclinical
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	studies in multiple sclerosis models, and encouraging data from the Phase 2/3 study of ADS-5102 in LID.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We expect to announce data from this Phase 2 trial in the first half of 2016, and if successful, will discuss the results with the FDA and potentially pursue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Phase 3 registration studies for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	this indication
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Additional indications for ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;5102
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We intend to continue to review the results of preclinical studies, clinical trials, and case reports published in peer reviewed medical journals to evaluate additional potential CNS indications for ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102, including hypokinetic movement disorders such as post-stroke deficits, and hyperkinetic movement disorders similar to LID, such as Huntington&#x2019;s chorea and tardive dyskinesia, and other neuropsychiatric disorders, such as depression, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, and Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease.&nbsp;&nbsp;We anticipate that by using the 505(b)(2) regulatory pathway, we will be able to initiate the clinical development of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 in new indications typically with Phase&nbsp;2 studies and will not need to conduct any Phase&nbsp;1 studies prior to initiating such Phase&nbsp;2 studies.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, we expect to retain substantial flexibility in our development plans and may be able to respond to new clinical data and changes in the commercial environment.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;8800 series (ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;5102
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;based fixed-dose combination products)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Using a similar product development strategy we employed with memantine, we are investigating and will potentially develop additional combination products based upon combining ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 with second agents.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have identified certain approved CNS drugs that we believe have the potential to be combined with ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 to treat chronic CNS conditions, including Parkinson&#x2019;s disease, Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease, multiple sclerosis, psychosis, and depression.&nbsp;&nbsp;Each combination will be designed to provide clinical benefits in specific indications in which it appears that combination therapy including ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 can address a significant unmet clinical need.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe we will be able to use the 505(b)(2) regulatory pathway to initiate clinical development of these product candidates.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional drug
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;drug interaction studies to assess the potential for interaction between ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 and the second agent may be required unless the two agents have been previously studied.&nbsp;&nbsp;We anticipate progressing into Phase 2/3 studies in combination therapies with minimal additional work.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ADS-4101 (Undisclosed) for treatment of e
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	pilepsy
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	13
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage16"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	As part of our ADS-4000 development program, which comprises single-agent compounds
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	outside of aminoadamantanes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, we are developing ADS-4101, an extended-release version of an FDA-approved drug for the treatment of epilepsy.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Epilepsy affects nearly 2.2 million people in the United States and 50 million people globally, with the U.S. anti-epileptic drug ("AED") market estimated to be $4 billion and growing.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Adequate seizure control is difficult to achieve, with 49% controlled with first mono therapy and 68% with combination therapy.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In addition, titration and tolerability make AED compliance difficult, with 20-40% adverse event rates being typical even with careful titration.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	To date, extended-release drugs have primarily addressed convenience, not titration and tolerability.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We have identified a pharmacokinetic modification of an approved antiepileptic drug, which is intended to provide improved efficacy in treating partial onset epileptic seizures while maintaining tolerability.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Formulation development is currently underway and we expect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	preclinical
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	dose-finding studies to be complete in 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	If the results of those studies are supportive, we plan to initiate clinical testing by the end of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2016 in a Phase 1 pharmacokinetic study
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Additional Programs (ADS-4000 and ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;9000 series)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We believe our product development strategy is broadly applicable to addressing limitations of other CNS drugs beyond aminoadamantanes whose pharmacokinetic profiles limit dosing.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are continuing to evaluate several different approved CNS drugs to enhance pharmacokinetics for such drugs alone (ADS-4000 series) or in fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose combinations with other approved drugs (ADS-9000 series) for potential use in a range of CNS indications.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Other wholly owned product candidates
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ADS-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	8704 (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	memantine HCl/donepezil HCl,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	outside of the United States only)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have retained the rights and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	continue to evaluate potential development and commercialization pathways for ADS-8704, a fixed-dose combination of our proprietary controlled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release version of memantine and donepezil for the treatment of moderate to severe dementia related to Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease in various non-U.S. markets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;8902 for severe influenza
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We developed ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;8902, a triple combination antiviral drug therapy for influenza, which is designed to inhibit viral replication at multiple points in the virus proliferation pathway.&nbsp;&nbsp;ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;8902 is a proprietary fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose combination product containing three FDA approved products, amantadine, oseltamivir, and ribavirin.&nbsp;&nbsp;The National Institutes of Health, is currently conducting a multi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;center, 700 patient Phase 2/3 trial of amantadine, oseltamivir, and ribavirin for the treatment of severe influenza.&nbsp;&nbsp;The trial was initiated in 2011 and as of December 2015, it had randomized 472 patients.&nbsp;&nbsp;As the rate of enrollment in the trial is heavily dependent on the incidence and severity of seasonal influenza each year, we have not projected an anticipated completion date for the trial.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the National Institutes of Health trial is successful, we may seek to license rights to ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;8902 to pharmaceutical companies for which the treatment of influenza is a commercial focus.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2010, we suspended further internal activities on ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;8902, due to the expected length of the clinical trial and a change in our strategic focus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Partnered products
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Namenda XR and Namzaric
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Through a partnership with Forest Laboratories,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our portfolio includes two drugs commercially available in the United States: Namzaric (memantine hydrochloride extended-release and donepezil hydrochloride) capsules (formerly MDX-8704) and Namenda XR (memantine hydrochloride) extended release capsules, launched in May 2015 and June 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Under the terms of the license agreement, entered into in November 2012, Forest Laboratories
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	substantially controls the commercialization of these products in the United States and the intellectual property rights subject to the license agreement, including the prosecution, maintenance, and enforcement of such rights, in the United States
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Overview of Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease dementia
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease dementia is a progressive neurodegenerative condition that affects over 5&nbsp;million people in the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;There is no known cure for Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease or any of the other conditions that cause dementia.&nbsp;&nbsp;Existing pharmaceutical therapies are approved for the treatment of symptoms of the disease, but have not been shown to alter disease progression.&nbsp;&nbsp;Even if disease modifying therapies are developed and approved, we believe it is likely that there will be a continuing need for symptomatic treatments.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2014, approximately 2.7&nbsp;million people in the United States were treated for Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease dementia, and U.S. sales of pharmaceutical treatments for Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease were approximately $2.9&nbsp;billion.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe that the number of people treated for Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease will
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	14
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage17"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	continue to increase as the number of elderly people in the United States increases, diagnosis of dementia becomes more common, and health care reform improves access to treatments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Existing treatments for Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease dementia
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The only two classes of drugs approved for the treatment of Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease dementia are acetylcholinesterase inhibitors, or AChEIs, and NMDA receptor antagonists.&nbsp;&nbsp;Donepezil is the leading AChEI, and forms of memantine are the only NMDA receptor antagonists approved for Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease.&nbsp;&nbsp;Memantine is currently marketed by Forest in the United States in an immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release version under the brand name Namenda and in a controlled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release version under the brand name Namenda XR.&nbsp;&nbsp;Donepezil is sold by Pfizer and Eisai under the brand name Aricept and as a generic drug by a number of manufacturers.&nbsp;&nbsp;Namenda XR is approved for the treatment of moderate to severe dementia related to Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease, and donepezil is approved for the treatment of dementia in patients with mild to severe Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Both memantine and donepezil are considered to be generally safe and well tolerated.&nbsp;&nbsp;The most common side effects of memantine are headache, diarrhea, and dizziness.&nbsp;&nbsp;The most common side effects of donepezil are nausea, diarrhea, not sleeping well, vomiting, muscle cramps, feeling tired, and not wanting to eat.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Treatment of moderate to severe Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease dementia with combination therapy
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The concurrent use of memantine and donepezil is a well
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;established treatment option for patients with moderate to severe dementia related to Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease.&nbsp;&nbsp;The current treatment recommendations from the American Association of Geriatric Psychiatry encourage the use of an AChEI for the treatment of mild Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease and then to add memantine when patients progress to the moderate phase of the disease.&nbsp;&nbsp;Of the approximately 1,200,000 patients treated with Namenda/Namenda XR annually in the U.S., we estimate that approximately 70% of these patients also receive an AChEI treatment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Concurrent use of memantine and donepezil is supported by clinical data, which shows that in patients with moderate to severe Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease, combination therapy resulted in a statistically significant improvement in the Severe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Impairment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Battery, or SIB, a commonly used outcome measure, as compared to treatment with donepezil alone.&nbsp;&nbsp;A second study demonstrated that concurrent use of Namenda XR and an AChEI also demonstrated a statistically significant improvement in the SIB as compared to treatment with donepezil alone.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Concurrent treatment with memantine and donepezil is generally safe and well tolerated with the most common side effects seen in clinical trials being dizziness, headache, and diarrhea.&nbsp;&nbsp;Of these side effects, incidence of dizziness with concurrent treatment is 5% as compared with 1% for treatment with donepezil alone.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The Namzaric solution
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In conjunction with Forest, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	developed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and launched
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Namzaric, a once
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	daily fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose combination of Namenda XR and donepezil, to simplify the co
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;administration of these drugs by a patient or caregiver with the goal of increasing compliance and adherence to the prescribed regimen.&nbsp;&nbsp;Namenda XR exhibits&nbsp;a much lower initial rise in plasma concentration when compared to immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release memantine, which we believe is central to its dosing protocol of once
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	daily administration and at a higher daily dose as compared to immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release memantine.&nbsp;&nbsp;By improving the tolerability and formulating a once
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	daily preparation of memantine, we have enabled a once
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	daily fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose combination of memantine with donepezil.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, Namzaric capsules can be opened to sprinkle
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the contents on food.&nbsp;&nbsp;Forest made Namzaric available in two dose strengths, a combination of 28 mg memantine ER and 10 mg donepezil and a combination of 14 mg memantine ER and 10 mg donepezil.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe that Namzaric has the potential to be adopted by patients already taking combination therapy, as well as moderate to severe patients currently taking donepezil alone.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Forest has submitted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a supplemental application to expand the indication for Namzaric to include patients who are on a stable dose of 10 mg donepezil and are ready to initiate treatment with Namzaric.&nbsp;&nbsp;This supplemental application will include manufacturing information to support two additional Namzaric doses: a fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose combination of 7 mg Namenda XR/10 mg donepezil and a fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose combination of 21 mg Namenda XR/10 mg donepezil.&nbsp;&nbsp;These additional dose combinations will allow patients who are receiving a stable dose of 10 mg donepezil but are na&#xEF;ve to Namenda XR to initiate treatment with Namzaric while utilizing the same three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;step titration that is currently approved for Namenda XR.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	15
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage18"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Research and Development
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We continue to maintain our commitment to research and development, and a significant portion of our operating expenses is related to research and development.&nbsp;&nbsp;See &#x201C;Item&nbsp;8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data&#x201D; of this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;K for costs and expenses related to research and development, and other financial information for each of the fiscal years 2015, 2014 and 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Intellectual property
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our success will significantly depend upon our ability to obtain and maintain patent and other intellectual property and proprietary protection for our drug candidates, including usage, pharmacokinetic, composition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;matter, and formulation patents, as well as patent and other intellectual property and proprietary protection for our novel discoveries and other important technology inventions and know
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;how.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to patents, we rely upon unpatented trade secrets, know
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;how, and continuing technological innovation to develop and maintain our competitive position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We seek to protect our proprietary information, in part, by using confidentiality agreements with our commercial partners, collaborators, employees, and consultants and invention assignment agreements with our employees and selected consultants.&nbsp;&nbsp;Despite these measures, any of our intellectual property and proprietary rights could be challenged, invalidated, circumvented, infringed, or misappropriated, or such intellectual property and proprietary rights may not be sufficient to permit us to take advantage of current market trends or otherwise to provide competitive advantages.&nbsp;&nbsp;For more information, please see &#x201C;Risk factors&#x2014;Risks related to intellectual property.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our current products and product candidates are based on novel discoveries related to the clinical implications of the timing of administration of drugs and pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic relationships.&nbsp;&nbsp;These discoveries led us to modify the pharmacokinetic profile of existing drugs in a manner that enables increased tolerability of higher doses as compared to immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release versions.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are able to apply these pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic insights to the development of novel fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose combination therapeutics, potentially yielding significant clinical benefits.&nbsp;&nbsp;As such, our intellectual property covers the novel pharmacokinetic properties of our formulations and combinations and their methods of use.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of February&nbsp;15, 2016, we owned 24 issued U.S. patents, 15 U.S. patent applications and additional patents and patent applications in other jurisdictions.&nbsp;&nbsp;The patent portfolios for Namenda&nbsp;XR, Namzaric, ADS-8704, and ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 as of February&nbsp;15, 2016 are summarized below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Namenda XR, Namzaric and ADS-8704
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Namenda XR and Namzaric are covered by a total of 13 of our issued U.S. patents containing method and compositions claims relating to their pharmacokinetic profile and method claims relating to dosing of memantine.&nbsp;&nbsp;These patents expire as late as 2029 and are exclusively licensed to Forest.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also own additional foreign patents and patent applications covering Namenda XR, Namzaric, and ADS-8704.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;5102
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 is currently covered by a total of nine issued U.S. patents and 11 additional patent applications containing method and composition claims relating to their pharmacokinetic profile and dosing of amantadine.&nbsp;&nbsp;These patents expire as late as 2030.&nbsp;&nbsp;These patents and patent applications are wholly owned by us and are not subject to any license agreements.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also own additional foreign patent applications covering ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Sales and marketing
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We intend to commercialize ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 in the United States, subject to FDA approval, by developing our own sales force and in other markets through distribution agreements and collaborations with CNS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;focused pharmaceutical companies.&nbsp;&nbsp;We plan to focus our commercial efforts on the approximately 4,000 neurologists and movement disorder specialists who are responsible for the treatment of approximately 60% of the patients in the United States with LID.&nbsp;&nbsp;As these physician specialists are heavily concentrated in major urban markets, we believe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	an approximately 30 to 60 member sales force will provide adequate reach and frequency of communication for successful
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	commercialization.&nbsp;&nbsp;We intend that the members of our sales force will have proven experience and be able to effectively communicate the clinical value and pharmacoeconomic advantage of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102.&nbsp;&nbsp;To complement the sales force, we will recruit experienced sales management, marketing, and third party reimbursement professionals to support our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage19"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	commercialization efforts.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe a targeted sales force will allow us to more effectively compete for future acquisitions and in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;licensing opportunities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	License agreement with Forest
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In November 2012, we entered in a license agreement with a wholly owned subsidiary of Forest.&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the terms of the license agreement, we granted Forest: an exclusive license, with the right to sublicense, under the relevant elements of our intellectual property, to commercialize human therapeutics containing memantine in the United States; a co
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;exclusive license along with us, with the right to sublicense, to develop and manufacture such products in the United States; and a non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;exclusive license, with a right to sublicense, to develop and manufacture (but not commercialize) such products outside of the United States solely in support of the development or commercialization of such products within the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;The license agreement established a joint development committee consisting of representatives from us and Forest to oversee the development of a fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose memantine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;donepezil product, such as Namzaric, in the United States with Forest having final decision making authority with certain restrictions.&nbsp;&nbsp;Forest is required to use commercially reasonable efforts to develop such a product in accordance with development and regulatory plans that we and Forest have mutually agreed upon that may be modified by the joint development committee or by Forest pursuant to the terms of the agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Forest is responsible for paying all costs associated with such development and reimburses us on a cost
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;plus basis for work performed by us at its request in support of the development.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, Forest is required at its expense to use commercially reasonable efforts to commercialize fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose memantine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;donepezil products in the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Under our license agreement with Forest, we received a $65&nbsp;million upfront payment in November 2012 and since 2012, a total of $95&nbsp;million of development and regulatory milestones, including a final $30&nbsp;million milestone payment in the fourth quarter of 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Commencing five years after the initial launch of a fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose memantine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;donepezil product in the United States, such as Namzaric, which Forest launched in May 2015, we are entitled to receive royalties at rates ranging from the low double digits to the mid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;teens on the net sales by Forest, its affiliates, and any sublicensees of such products in the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, commencing in June of 2018, we are entitled to receive low to mid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;single digit royalties on net sales in the United States by Forest, its affiliates, or any of its sublicensees of controlled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release versions of memantine, such as Namenda XR, or any other product covered by the terms of the license agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Forest&#x2019;s obligation to pay royalties with respect to fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose memantine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;donepezil products continues until the later of (i)&nbsp;15&nbsp;years after the commercial launch of the first fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose memantine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;donepezil product by Forest in the United States or (ii)&nbsp;the expiration of the Orange Book listed patents for which Forest obtained rights from us covering such product.&nbsp;&nbsp;Forest&#x2019;s obligations to pay royalties with respect to controlled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release versions of memantine or any other product covered by the agreement continue until the expiration of our Orange Book listed patents covering such product.&nbsp;&nbsp;Forest&#x2019;s obligations to pay royalties are subject to reduction in certain circumstances.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, Forest shall have no obligation to pay any royalty with respect to any product covered by the license agreement in any quarter in which there is significant competition from generic products, as defined in the agreement, in the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the terms of the license agreement, Forest substantially controls the commercialization of the products and the intellectual property rights subject to the license agreement, including the prosecution, maintenance, and enforcement of such rights.&nbsp;&nbsp;If we or our affiliates develop or commercialize the licensed products outside of the United States (other than in Japan) or otherwise enable a third party to do so, and such development or commercialization requires the use of or reference to certain data generated pursuant to the development plan, we will be obligated to make certain payments to Forest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The license agreement terminates on a product by product basis upon the expiration of all royalty obligations with respect to each product and terminates in its entirety upon the expiration of all royalty obligations with respect to all products covered by the license agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon expiration of the license agreement with respect to a product, all licenses, and other rights granted to Forest by us with respect to that product become fully paid up and irrevocable.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, Forest may terminate the license agreement with respect to fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose memantine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;donepezil products by delivering to us notice of its intent to cease development and commercialization of such products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As Forest has fully paid all the milestone payments to us under the license agreement, our rights to participate in and influence the prosecution, maintenance, and enforcement of the intellectual property rights subject to the license has decreased.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, our remedy for any breach of the license agreement by Forest is to seek damages or equitable relief, not termination of the license agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Furthermore, we have no right to terminate the license agreement with respect to controlled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release version of memantine or other products that are not fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose memantine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;donepezil products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	17
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage20"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Competition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our industry is highly competitive and subject to rapid and significant technological change.&nbsp;&nbsp;While we believe that our development experience and scientific knowledge provide us with competitive advantages, we may face competition from large pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies, smaller pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies, specialty pharmaceutical companies, generic drug companies, academic institutions, government agencies and research institutions, and others.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Many of our competitors may have significantly greater financial, technical, and human resources than we have.&nbsp;&nbsp;Mergers and acquisitions in the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries may result in even more resources being concentrated among a smaller number of our competitors.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our commercial opportunity could be reduced or eliminated if our competitors develop or market products or other novel technologies that are more effective, safer, or less costly than any that will be commercialized by us, or obtain regulatory approval for their products more rapidly than we may obtain approval for ours.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our success will be based in part on our ability to identify, develop, and manage a portfolio of drugs that are safer, more efficacious, and/or more cost
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;effective than alternative therapies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;5102
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Currently, there are no FDA or EMA drug therapies approved for the treatment of LID.&nbsp;&nbsp;While a number of pharmaceutical companies, including Merck, Novartis, Osmotica Pharmaceuticals, Avanir Pharmaceuticals, Newron Pharmaceuticals, Neurolixis Inc, Amarantus BioScience, Addex Pharma, and Neurim Pharmaceuticals&nbsp;Ltd have had programs aimed at developing treatments for LID, we believe ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 is one of the most advanced.&nbsp;&nbsp;Other products in late stage development for Parkinson&#x2019;s disease include product candidates from Kyowa Hakko, Acorda, Neuroderm, Acadia, Bial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Portela CSA, Biotie Therapies Corp, Genervon Biopharmaceuticals, Pharma Two B, and Depomed.&nbsp;&nbsp;Products approved to treat late stage Parkinson&#x2019;s disease include Azilect (Teva), Requip XL (GlaxoSmithKline), Mirapex ER (Boehringer Ingelheim), Neupro Patch (UCB), Comtan (Novartis), Sinemet
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(Merck&nbsp;&amp;&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Inc.), Parcopa
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(Jazz Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc.), Apokyn
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(Bertek), Bromocriptine (Mylan Laboratories,&nbsp;Inc.), Zelapar&#x2122; (Valeant Pharmaceuticals International), Eldepryl
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(Somerset Pharmaceuticals&nbsp;Inc.), Tasmar
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(Valeant Pharmaceuticals International), Cogentin
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(Oaks Pharma Akorn), Exelon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(Novartis Pharmaceuticals Corp.), Stalevo
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(Novartis), Rytary (Impax), Duopa (Abbvie), and generic versions of amantadine and other drugs.&nbsp;&nbsp;Physicians may use these drugs to attempt to manage LID.&nbsp;&nbsp;In selective cases for late stage patients, physicians and patients/caregivers will consider neurosurgical intervention, such as deep brain stimulation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Namenda XR/Namzaric
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In the market for Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease treatments, Namenda XR and Namzaric compete or will compete with generic products such as galatamine, rivastigmine, and donepezil, as well as branded products such as the Exelon patch (Novartis) and Aricept 23 mg (Eisai).&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, Forest currently markets Namenda, the immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release version of memantine, which physicians and patients may favor instead of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Namenda XR, the controlled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release version.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, generic versions of Namenda became available in 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;Several generic manufacturers are currently seeking regulatory approval to market generic versions of Namenda XR and Namzaric.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are also aware that Lundbec
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	k, Otsuka and other biopharmaceutical companies are developing treatments for Alzheimer&#x2019;s disease that may compete with Namenda XR and Namzaric.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;party reimbursement
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Sales of pharmaceutical products depend in significant part on the availability of coverage and adequate reimbursement by third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;party payers, such as state and federal governmental authorities, including those that administer the Medicare and Medicaid programs, managed care organizations and private insurers.&nbsp;&nbsp;Decisions regarding the extent of coverage and amount of reimbursement to be provided for Namenda XR, Namzaric and ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 are or will be made on a plan by plan basis.&nbsp;&nbsp;Each plan determines whether or not it will provide coverage for a drug, what amount it will pay the manufacturer for the drug, and on what tier of its formulary the drug will be placed.&nbsp;&nbsp;The position of a drug on the formulary generally determines the co
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;payment that a patient will need to make to obtain the drug and can strongly influence the adoption of a drug by patients and physicians.&nbsp;&nbsp;Patients who are prescribed treatments for their conditions and providers performing the prescribed services generally rely on third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;party payers to reimburse all or part of the associated healthcare costs.&nbsp;&nbsp;Patients are unlikely to use our products unless coverage is provided and reimbursement is adequate to cover a significant portion of the cost of our products.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally, a third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;party payer&#x2019;s decision to provide coverage for a drug does not imply that an adequate reimbursement rate will be approved.&nbsp;&nbsp;Also, third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;party payers are developing increasingly sophisticated methods of controlling healthcare costs.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	18
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	coverage, reimbursement, and placement determinations are complex, take time, and are often the subject of extensive negotiations between the payer and the maker of the drug.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Forest is responsible for obtaining coverage and negotiating reimbursement amounts and formulary placement for Namenda XR and Namzaric.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under our agreement with Forest, we will be entitled to receive payments from Forest based on future net sales of these products.&nbsp;&nbsp;The amount of revenue we will receive under the agreement is therefore significantly dependent on the extent to which Forest is able to obtain favorable coverage, reimbursement, and formulary placement decisions from payers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We will be responsible for negotiating coverage, reimbursement, and formulary placement decisions for ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102, if approved.&nbsp;&nbsp;Coverage, reimbursements, and placement decisions for a new product are based on many factors including the coverage, reimbursement, and placement of already marketed branded drugs for the same or similar indications, the safety and efficacy of the new product, availability of generics for similar indications, and the clinical need for the new product.&nbsp;&nbsp;Currently, there are no drugs approved for the treatment of LID, and generic amantadine is not approved for this indication.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have had preliminary discussions regarding the potential coverage, reimbursement, and placement of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 with consultants and representatives of payers, but have not begun formal negotiations with any payers.&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on these discussions, we believe that if ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 is approved as the first product indicated for the treatment of LID, most payers are likely to extend coverage to it and that its placement on payer formularies and the amount of reimbursement will be influenced by the aforementioned products, generic amantadine, and generic and branded treatments for symptoms of Parkinson&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	disease.&nbsp;&nbsp;Within the Medicare program, as self
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;administered drugs, Namzaric and ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 would be, and Namenda XR is, reimbursed under the expanded prescription drug benefit, known as Medicare Part&nbsp;D.&nbsp;&nbsp;This program is a voluntary Medicare benefit administered by private plans that operate under contracts with the federal government.&nbsp;&nbsp;These Part&nbsp;D plans negoti
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ate discounts with drug manufacturers, which are passed on to each of the plan&#x2019;s enrollees.&nbsp;&nbsp;Historically, Part&nbsp;D beneficiaries have been exposed to significant out
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;pocket costs after they surpass an annual coverage limit and until they reach a catastrophic coverage threshold.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, changes made by recent legislation will reduce this patient coverage gap, known as the &#x201C;donut hole&#x201D;, by transitioning patient responsibility in that coverage range from 100% in 2010 to only 25% in 2020.&nbsp;&nbsp;To help achieve this reduction, since 2011, pharmaceutical manufacturers are required to pay quarterly discounts of 50% off the negotiated price of branded drugs issued to Medicare Part&nbsp;D patients in the donut hole.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	If a drug product is reimbursed by Medicare or Medicaid, pricing and rebate programs must comply with the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003, as applicable, as well as with the Medicaid rebate requirements of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1990, or the OBRA, and the Veterans Health Care Act of 1992, or the VHCA, each as amended.&nbsp;&nbsp;Among other things, the OBRA requires drug manufacturers to pay rebates on prescription drugs to state Medicaid programs and empowers states to negotiate rebates on pharmaceutical prices, which may result in prices for our future products that will likely be lower than the prices we might otherwise obtain.&nbsp;&nbsp;If products are made available to authorized users of the Federal Supply Schedule of the General Services Administration, additional laws and requirements apply.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	An ongoing trend has been for third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;party payers, including the U.S. government, to apply downward pressure on the reimbursement of pharmaceutical products.&nbsp;&nbsp;Also, the trend towards managed health care in the United States and the concurrent growth of organizations such as health maintenance organizations may result in lower reimbursement for pharmaceutical products.&nbsp;&nbsp;We expect that these trends will continue as these payers implement various proposals or regulatory policies, including various provisions of the recent health reform legislation that affects reimbursement of these products.&nbsp;&nbsp;There are currently, and we expect that there will continue to be, a number of federal and state proposals to implement controls on reimbursement and pricing, directly and indirectly.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Manufacturing
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We currently have no manufacturing facilities and limited personnel with manufacturing experience.&nbsp;&nbsp;We rely on third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;party manufacturers to produce bulk drug substance and drug products required for our clinical trials of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102.&nbsp;&nbsp;We plan to continue to rely upon contract manufacturers to manufacture commercial quantities of our ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 and other product candidates if and when we receive approval for marketing by the applicable regulatory authorities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	19
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage22"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our current products and product candidates are based upon controlled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release coated pellet products that are quite difficult to manufacture.&nbsp;&nbsp;As shown below, these products consist of an inert core, a drug layer, an optional seal coating, and controlled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release coatings.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our products are made in a fluidized bed coating machine in sequential steps.&nbsp;&nbsp;At each step, the intermediate product is assayed and released if it meets the particular specification for that step.&nbsp;&nbsp;Once the extended or controlled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release coating is applied, the assay includes a step to insure that the desired dissolution rate is achieved.&nbsp;&nbsp;These coatings are relatively thin, and susceptible to changes in raw materials, temperature, humidity, and other manufacturing process parameters.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have invested significant time and money to understand and manipulate drug release, and will continue to do so.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/02/23/0001558370-16-003389_ADMS20151231X10K006.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 4.017391IN; HEIGHT: 2.489731IN" ALT="PICTURE 1">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have clinical supplies of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 manufactured for us by a contract manufacturing organization under a development
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	agreement, and have put in place a commercial supply agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	seeking to qualify one or more additional manufacturers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Contract
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	manufacturers often encounter difficulties involving production yields, quality control, and quality assurance, as well as shortages of qualified personnel, resources, and equipment.&nbsp;&nbsp;Qualifying and negotiating long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;term contracts with manufacturers and providers of packaging services is a lengthy process.&nbsp;&nbsp;If at any time one or more of our qualified contract organizations were not able to manufacture our drug substance or provide the requisite services, our business and financial condition would be materially adversely affected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Forest is responsible for all manufacturing related to Namenda XR and Namzaric.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;party manufacturers, their facilities, and all lots of drug substance and drug products used in our clinical trials are required to be in compliance with current Good Manufacturing Practices, or cGMP.&nbsp;&nbsp;The cGMP regulations include requirements relating to organization of personnel, buildings and facilities, equipment, control of components and drug product containers and closures, production and process controls, packaging and labeling controls, holding and distribution, laboratory controls, records and reports, and returned or salvaged products.&nbsp;&nbsp;The manufacturing facilities for our products must meet cGMP requirements and FDA satisfaction before any product is approved and we can manufacture commercial products.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;party manufacturers are also subject to periodic inspections of facilities by the FDA and other authorities, including procedures and operations used in the testing and manufacture of our products to assess our compliance with applicable regulations.&nbsp;&nbsp;Failure to comply with statutory and regulatory requirements subjects a manufacturer to possible legal or regulatory action, including warning letters, the seizure or recall of products, injunctions, consent decrees placing significant restrictions on or suspending manufacturing operations, and civil and criminal penalties.&nbsp;&nbsp;These actions could have a material impact on the availability of our products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Government regulation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The FDA and comparable regulatory agencies in state and local jurisdictions and in foreign countries impose substantial requirements upon the clinical development, manufacture and marketing of pharmaceutical products.&nbsp;&nbsp;These agencies and other federal, state, and local entities regulate research and development activities and the testing, manufacture, quality control, safety, effectiveness, labeling, storage, recordkeeping, tracking, approval, import, export, advertising, and promotion of our products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
