	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage23"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The process required by the FDA before product candidates may be marketed in the United States generally involves the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	nonclinical laboratory and animal tests, including some that must be conducted in accordance with Good Laboratory Practices;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	submission of an IND, which must become effective before clinical trials may begin;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	adequate and well
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;controlled human clinical trials to establish the safety and efficacy of the proposed drug candidate for its intended use;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">

</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	pre-approval inspection of manufacturing facilities and selected clinical investigators for their compliance with Good Manufacturing Practices, or cGMP, and Good Clinical Practices; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	FDA approval of an NDA to permit commercial marketing for particular indications for use.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The testing and approval process requires substantial time, effort, and financial resources.&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to commencing the first clinical trial with a product candidate, we must submit an IND to the FDA.&nbsp;&nbsp;The IND automatically becomes effective 30&nbsp;days after receipt by the FDA, unless the FDA, within the 30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;day time period, raises safety concerns or questions about the conduct of the clinical trial by imposing a clinical hold.&nbsp;&nbsp;In such a case, the IND sponsor and the FDA must resolve any outstanding concerns before the clinical trial can begin.&nbsp;&nbsp;Submission of an IND may not result in FDA authorization to commence a clinical trial.&nbsp;&nbsp;A separate submission to the existing IND must be made for each successive clinical trial conducted during product development.&nbsp;&nbsp;Further, an independent institutional review board for each medical center proposing to conduct the clinical trial must review and approve the plan for any clinical trial and its informed consent form before the clinical trial commences at that center.&nbsp;&nbsp;Regulatory authorities or an institutional review board or the sponsor may suspend a clinical trial at any time on various grounds, including a finding that the subjects or patients are being exposed to an unacceptable health risk.&nbsp;&nbsp;Some studies also include a data safety monitoring board, which receives special access to unblinded data during the clinical trial and may halt the clinical trial if it determines that there is an unacceptable safety risk for subjects or other grounds, such as no demonstration of efficacy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In general, for purposes of NDA approval, human clinical trials are typically conducted in three sequential phases that may overlap.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Phase&nbsp;1&#x2014;Studies are initially conducted to test the product candidate for safety, dosage tolerance, absorption, metabolism, distribution, and excretion in healthy volunteers or patients.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Phase&nbsp;2&#x2014;Studies are conducted with groups of patients with a specified disease or condition to provide enough data to evaluate the preliminary efficacy, optimal dosages and dosing schedule, and expanded evidence of safety.&nbsp;&nbsp;Multiple Phase&nbsp;2 clinical trials may be conducted to obtain information prior to beginning larger and more expensive Phase&nbsp;3 clinical trials.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Phase&nbsp;3&#x2014;These clinical trials are undertaken in larger patient populations to further evaluate dosage, to provide statistically significant evidence of clinical efficacy, and to further test for safety in an expanded patient population at multiple clinical trial sites.&nbsp;&nbsp;These clinical trials are intended to establish the overall risk/benefit ratio of the product and provide an adequate basis for product labeling.&nbsp;&nbsp;These trials may be done globally to support global registrations.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our product development strategy often relies on using Phase 2/3 studies as a central element of our clinical development plans.&nbsp;&nbsp;Typically these studies involve the testing of two or more doses of a product candidate, as is characteristic of a Phase&nbsp;2 study, and also include a sufficient number of patients so that statistically significant evidence of efficacy can be obtained, as is characteristic of a Phase&nbsp;3 study.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, we conduct the studies in a manner that we believe is consistent with the requirements for a Phase&nbsp;3 study.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe this approach has the potential to significantly shorten the time frame required for clinical development.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FDA generally requires that sponsors successfully complete two Phase&nbsp;3 studies to obtain approval for a new drug, though in certain circumstances a single Phase&nbsp;3 study is sufficient.&nbsp;&nbsp;We design and conduct our Phase 2/3 studies in a manner that is intended to allow the study to qualify as a Phase&nbsp;3 study for the purposes of approval.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FDA has broad discretion in determining whether or not
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	21
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage24"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a completed Phase 2/3 study will be considered the equivalent of a Phase&nbsp;3 study for the purposes of approval, and there can be no assurance that the FDA will agree with our assessment that the design, conduct, and results of a Phase&nbsp;2/3 study are such that the study should be treated as a Phase&nbsp;3 study.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The FDA may require, or companies may pursue, additional clinical trials after a product is approved.&nbsp;&nbsp;These so
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;called Phase&nbsp;4 studies may be made a condition to be satisfied after approval.&nbsp;&nbsp;The results of Phase&nbsp;4 studies can confirm the effectiveness of a product candidate and can provide important safety information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Concurrent with clinical trials, companies usually complete additional animal studies and must also develop additional information about the chemistry and physical characteristics of the product candidate, as well as finalize a process for manufacturing the product in commercial quantities in accordance with cGMP requirements.&nbsp;&nbsp;The manufacturing process must be capable of consistently producing quality batches of the product candidate and, among other things, must develop methods for testing the identity, strength, quality and purity of the final product.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally, appropriate packaging must be selected and tested, and stability studies must be conducted to demonstrate that the product candidate does not undergo unacceptable deterioration over its shelf life.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ANDA approval process
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Drug Price Competition and Patent Term Restoration Act of 1984, commonly known as the Hatch
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Waxman Act, established abbreviated FDA approval procedures for drugs that are shown to be equivalent to proprietary drugs previously approved by the FDA through its NDA process.&nbsp;&nbsp;Approval to market and distribute these drugs is obtained by filing an abbreviated NDA, or ANDA, with the FDA.&nbsp;&nbsp;An ANDA is a comprehensive submission that contains, among other things, data and information pertaining to the active pharmaceutical ingredient, drug product formulation, specifications, and stability of the generic drug, as well as analytical methods, manufacturing process validation data, and quality control procedures.&nbsp;&nbsp;Premarket applications for generic drugs are termed abbreviated because they generally do not include preclinical and clinical data to demonstrate safety and effectiveness.&nbsp;&nbsp;Instead, a generic applicant must demonstrate that its product is bioequivalent to the innovator drug.&nbsp;&nbsp;In certain situations, an applicant may obtain ANDA approval of a generic product with a strength or dosage form that differs from a referenced innovator drug pursuant to the filing and approval of an ANDA suitability petition.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FDA will approve the generic product as suitable for an ANDA application if it finds that the generic product does not raise new questions of safety and effectiveness as compared to the innovator product.&nbsp;&nbsp;A product is not eligible for ANDA approval if the FDA determines that it is not equivalent to the referenced innovator drug, if it is intended for a different use, or if it is not subject to an approved suitability petition.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, such a product might be approved under an NDA, with supportive data from clinical trials.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	505(b)(2) approval process
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Section&nbsp;505(b)(2) of the FDCA provides an alternate regulatory pathway to FDA approval for new or improved formulations or new uses of previously approved drug products.&nbsp;&nbsp;Specifically, Section&nbsp;505(b)(2) permits the filing of an NDA where at least some of the information required for approval comes from studies not conducted by or for the applicant and for which the applicant has not obtained a right of reference.&nbsp;&nbsp;The applicant may rely upon the FDA&#x2019;s findings of safety and effectiveness for an approved product that acts as the Reference Listed Drug, or RLD.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FDA may also require 505(b)(2) applicants to perform additional studies or measurements to support the change from the RLD.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FDA may then approve the new product candidate for all or some of the labeled indications for which the referenced product has been approved, as well as for any new indication sought by the Section&nbsp;505(b)(2) applicant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our current and anticipated product candidates based upon ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 are or will be based on already approved active pharmaceutical ingredients, or APIs, rather than new chemical entities, and a formulation that has been through Phase&nbsp;1 studies.&nbsp;&nbsp;Accordingly, we expect to be able to rely on information from previously conducted studies involving our ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 formulation in our clinical development plans and our NDA submissions.&nbsp;&nbsp;For product candidates that involve novel fixed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose combinations of existing drugs or for studies of an existing product or product candidate in a new indication, we expect that we will generally be able to initiate Phase 2/3 studies without conducting any new non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;clinical or Phase&nbsp;1 studies.&nbsp;&nbsp;In those instances where our product candidate is a pharmacokinetically enhanced version of an approved API, we will need to conduct certain non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;clinical and Phase&nbsp;1 studies to confirm the pharmacokinetic profile of the product candidate prior to conducting Phase 2/3 studies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	22
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage25"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Orange Book listing
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In seeking approval for a drug through an NDA, including a 505(b)(2) NDA, applicants are required to list with the FDA certain patents whose claims cover the applicant&#x2019;s product.&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon approval of an NDA, each of the patents listed in the application for the drug is then published in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Approved Drug Products with Therapeutic Equivalence Evaluations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, also known as the Orange Book.&nbsp;&nbsp;Any applicant who files an ANDA seeking approval of a generic equivalent version of a drug listed in the Orange Book or a 505(b)(2) NDA referencing a drug listed in the Orange Book must certify to the FDA that (1)&nbsp;no patent information on the drug product that is the subject of the application has been submitted to the FDA; (2)&nbsp;such patent has expired; (3)&nbsp;the date on which such patent expires; or (4)&nbsp;such patent is invalid or will not be infringed upon by the manufacture, use, or sale of the drug product for which the application is submitted.&nbsp;&nbsp;This last certification is known as a Paragraph&nbsp;IV certification.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the competitor has provided a Paragraph&nbsp;IV certification to the FDA, the competitor must also send notice of the Paragraph&nbsp;IV certification to the holder of the NDA for the RLD and the patent owner once the application has been accepted for filing by the FDA.&nbsp;&nbsp;The NDA holder or patent owner may then initiate a patent infringement lawsuit in response to the notice of the Paragraph&nbsp;IV certification.&nbsp;&nbsp;The filing of a patent infringement lawsuit within 45&nbsp;days of the receipt of a Paragraph&nbsp;IV certification prevents the FDA from approving the application until the earlier of 30&nbsp;months from the date of the lawsuit, expiration of the patent, settlement of the lawsuit, or a decision in the infringement case that is favorable to the applicant.&nbsp;&nbsp;The applicant may also elect to submit a &#x201C;Section&nbsp;VIII&#x201D; statement certifying that its proposed label does not contain, or carves out, any language regarding the patented method
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;use rather than certify to a listed method
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;use patent.&nbsp;&nbsp;We and Forest have received notices of ANDAs submitted to the FDA requesting permission to manufacture and market generic versions of Namenda XR, and we, Forest, Forest Laboratories Holdings&nbsp;Ltd., Merz Pharma&nbsp;GmbH&nbsp;&amp;&nbsp;Co. KGaA, and Merz Pharmaceuticals&nbsp;GmbH are currently in litigation with the notifying parties.&nbsp;&nbsp;For further information, see &#x201C;Item 3. Legal proceedings.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	NDA submission and review by the FDA
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The results of product development, nonclinical studies, and clinical trials are submitted to the FDA as part of an NDA.&nbsp;&nbsp;The submission of an NDA requires payment of a substantial user fee to the FDA.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FDA may convene an advisory committee to provide clinical insight on application review questions.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FDA reviews applications to determine, among other things, whether a product is safe and effective for its intended use and whether the manufacturing controls are adequate to assure and preserve the product&#x2019;s identity, strength, quality, and purity.&nbsp;&nbsp;Before approving an NDA, the FDA will inspect the facility or facilities where the product is manufactured.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FDA will not approve an application unless it determines that the manufacturing processes and facilities are in compliance with cGMP requirements and adequate to assure consistent production of the product within required specifications.&nbsp;&nbsp;Once the NDA submission has been accepted for filing, which occurs, if at all, within 60&nbsp;days after submission of the NDA, the FDA&#x2019;s goal for a non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;priority review of a 505(b)(2) NDA is ten months to complete the review process for the application and respond to the applicant, which can take the form of either a Complete Response Letter or Approval.&nbsp;&nbsp;The review process is often significantly extended by FDA requests for additional information, studies, or clarification.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FDA may delay or refuse approval of an NDA if applicable regulatory criteria are not satisfied, require additional testing or information, and/or require post
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;marketing testing and surveillance to monitor safety or efficacy of a product.&nbsp;&nbsp;FDA approval of any NDA submitted by us will be at a time the FDA chooses.&nbsp;&nbsp;Also, if regulatory approval of a product is granted, such approval may entail limitations on the indicated uses for which such product may be marketed.&nbsp;&nbsp;Once approved, the FDA may withdraw the product approval if compliance with pre- and post-marketing regulatory standards is not maintained or if problems occur after the product reaches the marketplace.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, the FDA may require Phase&nbsp;4 post
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;marketing studies to monitor the effect of approved products, and may limit further marketing of the product based on the results of these post
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;marketing studies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Post
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;approval requirements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Any products manufactured or distributed by us pursuant to FDA approvals are subject to continuing regulation by the FDA, including recordkeeping requirements and reporting of adverse experiences.&nbsp;&nbsp;Drug and biologic manufacturers and their subcontractors are required to register their establishments with the FDA and certain state agencies, and are subject to periodic unannounced inspections by the FDA and certain state agencies for compliance with cGMP, which impose certain procedural and documentation requirements upon us and our third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;party manufacturers.&nbsp;&nbsp;We cannot be certain that we or our present or future suppliers will be able to comply with the cGMP regulations and other FDA regulatory requirements.&nbsp;&nbsp;If our present or future suppliers are not able to comply with these requirements, the FDA may halt our clinical trials, require us to recall a product from distribution, or withdraw approval of the NDA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	23
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage26"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The FDA closely regulates the marketing and promotion of drugs.&nbsp;&nbsp;A company can make only those claims relating to safety and efficacy, purity, and potency that are approved by the FDA.&nbsp;&nbsp;Failure to comply with these requirements can result in adverse publicity, warning letters, corrective advertising, and potential civil and criminal penalties.&nbsp;&nbsp;Physicians may prescribe legally available products for uses that are not described in the product&#x2019;s labeling and that differ from those tested by us and approved by the FDA.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such off
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;label uses are common across medical specialties.&nbsp;&nbsp;Physicians may believe that such off
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;label uses are the best treatment for many patients in varied circumstances.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FDA does not regulate the behavior of physicians in their choice of treatments.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FDA does, however, restrict manufacturer&#x2019;s communications on the subject of off
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;label use.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Moreover, the recently enacted Drug Supply Chain Security Act imposes new obligations on manufacturers of pharmaceutical products related to product and tracking and tracing.&nbsp;&nbsp;Among the requirements of this new legislation, manufacturers will be required to provide certain information regarding the drug products to individuals and entities to which product ownership is transferred, label drug product with a product identifier, and keep certain records regarding the drug product.&nbsp;&nbsp;The transfer of information to subsequent product owners by manufacturers will eventually be required to be done electronically.&nbsp;&nbsp;Manufacturers will also be required to verify that purchasers of the manufacturers&#x2019; products are appropriately licensed.&nbsp;&nbsp;Further, under this new legislation, manufactures will have drug product investigation, quarantine, disposition, and notification responsibilities related to counterfeit, diverted, stolen, and intentionally adulterated products, as well as products that are the subject of fraudulent transactions or which are otherwise unfit for distribution such that they would be reasonably likely to result in serious health consequences or death.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Other healthcare regulations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our business activities, including but not limited to, research, sales, promotion, distribution, medical education, and other activities following product approval will be subject to regulation by numerous regulatory and law enforcement authorities in the United States in addition to the FDA, including potentially the Department of Justice, the Department of Health and Human Services and its various divisions, including the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, and state and local governments.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our business activities must comply with numerous healthcare laws, including but not limited to, the federal Anti
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Kickback Statute, the False Claims Act, the Veterans Health Care Act, and similar state laws.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The federal Anti
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Kickback Statute prohibits, among other things, any person or entity from knowingly and willfully offering, paying, soliciting, or receiving any remuneration, directly or indirectly, overtly or covertly, in cash or in kind, to induce or in return for purchasing, leasing, ordering, or arranging for the purchase, lease, or order of any item or service reimbursable under Medicare, Medicaid, or other federal healthcare programs.&nbsp;&nbsp;The term remuneration has been interpreted broadly to include anything of value.&nbsp;&nbsp;There are a number of statutory exceptions and regulatory safe harbors protecting some common activities from prosecution.&nbsp;&nbsp;The exceptions and safe harbors are drawn narrowly and practices that involve remuneration that may be alleged to be intended to induce prescribing, purchasing, or recommending may be subject to scrutiny if they do not qualify for an exception or safe harbor.&nbsp;&nbsp;Failure to meet all of the requirements of a particular applicable statutory exception or regulatory safe harbor does not make the conduct per se illegal under the Anti
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Kickback Statute.&nbsp;&nbsp;Instead, the legality of the arrangement will be evaluated on a case
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;case basis based on a cumulative review of all of its facts and circumstances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The federal False Claims Act prohibits, among other things, any person or entity from knowingly presenting, or causing to be presented, a false claim for payment to, or approval by, the federal government or knowingly making, using, or causing to be made or used a false record or statement material to a false or fraudulent claim to the federal government.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We and our business activities are subject to the civil monetary penalties statute, which imposes penalties against any person or entity who, among other things, is determined to have presented or caused to be presented a claim to a federal health program that the person knows or should know is for an item or service that was not provided as claimed or is false or fraudulent.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Additionally, the federal Physician Payments Sunshine Act within the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, or PPACA, and its implementing regulations, require certain manufacturers of drugs, devices, biological, and medical supplies for which payment is available under Medicare, Medicaid, or the Children&#x2019;s Health Insurance Program (with certain exceptions) to report information related to certain payments or other transfers of value made or distributed to physicians and teaching hospitals, or to entities or individuals at the request of, or designated on behalf of, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	24
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage27"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	physicians and teaching hospitals and to report annually certain ownership and investment interests held by physicians and their immediate family members.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition, we may be subject to data privacy and security regulation by both the federal government and the states in which we conduct our business.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996, or HIPAA, as amended by the Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act, or HITECH, and its implementing regulations, imposes certain requirements relating to the privacy, security and transmission of individually identifiable health information.&nbsp;&nbsp;Among other things, HITECH makes HIPAA&#x2019;s privacy and security standards directly applicable to business associates&#x2014;independent contractors or agents of covered entities that receive or obtain protected health information in connection with providing a service on behalf of a covered entity.&nbsp;&nbsp;HITECH also created four new tiers of civil monetary penalties, amended HIPAA to make civil and criminal penalties directly applicable business associates and possibly other persons, and gave state attorneys general new authority to file civil actions for damages or injunctions in federal courts to enforce the federal HIPAA laws and seek attorneys&#x2019; fees and costs associated with pursuing federal civil actions.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, state laws govern the privacy and security of health information in certain circumstances, many of which differ from each other in significant ways and may not have the same effect, thus complicating compliance efforts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Veterans Health Care Act of 1992 requires manufacturers of &#x201C;covered drugs&#x201D; to offer those drugs for sale to certain federal agencies, including but not limited to, the Department of Veterans Affairs, on the Federal Supply Schedule, which requires compliance with applicable federal procurement laws.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Depending on the circumstances, failure to comply with these laws can result in penalties, including criminal, civil, and/or administrative criminal penalties, damages, fines, disgorgement, exclusion of products from reimbursement under government programs, &#x201C;qui tam&#x201D; actions brought by individual whistleblowers in the name of the government, refusal to allow us to enter into supply contracts, including government contracts, reputational harm, diminished profits, and future earnings, and the curtailment or restructuring of our operations, any of which could adversely affect our business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The United States and some foreign jurisdictions are considering or have enacted a number of legislative and regulatory proposals designed to change the healthcare system in ways that could affect our ability to sell our products profitably.&nbsp;&nbsp;Among policy makers and payers in the United States and elsewhere, there is significant interest in promoting changes in healthcare systems with the stated goals of containing healthcare costs, improving quality and/or expanding access.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the United States, the pharmaceutical industry has been a particular focus of these efforts and has been significantly affected by major legislative initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	For example, in March 2010, the PPACA was passed, which has the potential to substantially change health care financing by both governmental and private insurers, and to significantly impact the U.S. pharmaceutical industry.&nbsp;&nbsp;The PPACA, among other things, revised the methodology by which rebates owed by manufacturers to the state and federal government for covered outpatient drugs under the Medicaid Drug Rebate Program are calculated, increased the minimum Medicaid rebates owed by most manufacturers under the Medicaid Drug Rebate Program, extended the Medicaid Drug Rebate program to utilization of prescriptions of individuals enrolled in Medicaid managed care organizations, subjected manufacturers to new annual fees and taxes for certain branded prescription drugs, and provided incentives to programs that increase the federal government&#x2019;s comparative effectiveness research.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The Foreign Corrupt Practices Act
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, or FCPA, prohibits any U.S. individual or business from paying, offering, or authorizing payment or offering of anything of value, directly or indirectly, to any foreign official, political party, or candidate for the purpose of influencing any act or decision of the foreign entity in order to assist the individual or business in obtaining or retaining business.&nbsp;&nbsp;The FCPA also obligates companies whose securities are listed in the United States to comply with accounting provisions requiring the company to maintain books and records that accurately and fairly reflect all transactions of the corporation, including international subsidiaries, and to devise and maintain an adequate system of internal accounting controls for international operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Federal laws providing for patent term extensions and data exclusivity
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Provisions of various federal laws may allow a company to extend market exclusivity for a product beyond the expiration dates of the patents covering the product by either extending the term of the patents or limiting the right of a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	25
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	competitor to reference the company&#x2019;s data in a regulatory submission.&nbsp;&nbsp;These laws include the Hatch
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Waxman Act and the Best Pharmaceuticals for Children Act of 2002.&nbsp;&nbsp;We do not anticipate materially benefiting from these provisions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Foreign regulation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition to regulations in the United States, we will be subject to a variety of foreign regulations governing clinical trials and commercial sales and distribution of our products to the extent we choose to develop or sell any products outside of the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;The approval process varies from country to country and the time may be longer or shorter than that required to obtain FDA approval.&nbsp;&nbsp;The requirements governing the conduct of clinical trials, product licensing, pricing, and reimbursement vary greatly from country to country.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Employees
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;time
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	31
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	engaged in research and development.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our employees are not represented by labor unions or covered by collective bargaining agreements.&nbsp;&nbsp;We consider our relationship with our employees to be good.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Corporate and other Information
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We were incorporated in Delaware in November 2000 under the name NeuroMolecular,&nbsp;Inc.&nbsp;&nbsp;In December 2004, we changed our name to NeuroMolecular Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc., and in July 2007 we changed our name to Adamas Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our principal executive offices are located at 1900 Powell Street, Suite&nbsp;750, Emeryville, California&nbsp;94608, and our telephone number is (510)&nbsp;450
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;3500.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our website address is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	www.adamaspharma.com
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;References to our website address do not constitute incorporation by reference of the information contained on the website, and the information contained on the website is not part of this document.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We make available, free of charge on our corporate website, copies of our Annual Reports on Form&nbsp;10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;K, Quarterly Reports on Form&nbsp;10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Q, Current Reports on Form&nbsp;8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;K, Proxy Statements, and all amendments to these reports, as soon as reasonably practicable after such material is electronically filed with or furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also show detail about stock trading by corporate insiders by providing access to SEC Forms&nbsp;3, 4 and 5.&nbsp;&nbsp;The public may also read and copy any materials filed by us with the SEC at the SEC&#x2019;s Public Reference Room at 100 F Street, NE, Room 1580, Washington, DC 20549.&nbsp;&nbsp;The public may obtain information on the operation of the Public Reference Room by calling the SEC at 1-800-SEC-0330.&nbsp;&nbsp;This information may also be obtained from the SEC&#x2019;s on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;line database, which is located at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	www.sec.go
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	v.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our common stock is traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the symbol &#x201C;ADMS&#x201D;.

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are an &#x201C;emerging growth company,&#x201D; as defined in the Jumpstart Our Business Startups Act of 2012.&nbsp;&nbsp;As such, we are eligible for exemptions from various reporting requirements applicable to other public companies that are not emerging growth companies, including, but not limited to, not being required to comply with the auditor attestation requirements of Section&nbsp;404 of the Sarbanes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Oxley Act of 2002 and reduced disclosure obligations regarding executive compensation.&nbsp;&nbsp;We will remain an emerging growth company until the earlier of (1)&nbsp;December&nbsp;31, 2019, (2)&nbsp;the last day of the fiscal year (a)&nbsp;in which we have total annual gross revenue of at least $1.0&nbsp;billion or (b)&nbsp;in which we are deemed to be a large accelerated filer, which means the market value of our common stock that is held by non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;affiliates exceeds $700&nbsp;million as of the prior June&nbsp;30th, and (3)&nbsp;the date on which we have issued more than $1.0&nbsp;billion in non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;convertible debt securities during the prior three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;year period.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item&nbsp;1A.&nbsp;&nbsp;Risk Factors
</FONT>
<A NAME="ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM1A_RISK_FACTORS">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We have identified the following risks and uncertainties that may have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition, results of operations and future growth prospects.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our business could be harmed by any of these risks.&nbsp;&nbsp;The risks and uncertainties described below are not the only ones we face.&nbsp;&nbsp;The trading price of our common stock could decline due to any of these risks, and you may lose all or part of your investment.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	In assessing these risks, you should also refer to the other information contained in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;K, including our condensed consolidated financial statements and related notes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Risks related to our financial condition and need for additional capital
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Although we reported net income for the fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	2013, and 2012, we incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	significant losses in prior years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	and the fiscal year ended December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	and expect to incur substantial losses in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are a clinical-stage pharmaceutical company and do not currently directly market any products.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We currently exclusively license U.S. patent rights for two approved products, Namzaric (formerly known as MDX-8704) and Namenda XR, to Forest Laboratories Holdings Limited, or Forest, an indirect wholly-owned subsidiary of Allergan&nbsp;plc, and Forest markets Namzaric and Namenda XR in the United States, but we do not currently receive royalties on the sales of those products.&nbsp;&nbsp;We continue to incur significant research and development and general and administrative expenses related to our product candidates and our operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;Although we reported net income for the fiscal years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, 2013, and 2012, this was almost entirely due to milestone payments we received pursuant to our license agreement with Forest.&nbsp;&nbsp;We incurred significant operating losses in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2011
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and prior years and as we received our final milestone payment in 2014 pursuant to our license agreement with Forest, we expect to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	incur substantial and increasing losses for the foreseeable future.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we had an accumulated deficit of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	62.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have financed our operations pr
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	imarily through our collaboration with Forest, public and private equity offerings, and, to a lesser extent, government grants, venture debt, and benefits from tax credits made available under a federal stimulus program supporting drug development.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have devoted substantially all of our efforts to research and development, including clinical studies, but have not completed development of any product candidates.&nbsp;&nbsp;We anticipate that our expenses will increase substantially as we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	:
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	To be profitable in the future, we or our current and future potential collaboration partners must succeed in developing and commercializing products with significant market potential.&nbsp;&nbsp;This will require us or our partners to be successful in a range of activities, including advancing product candidates into clinical trials, completing clinical studies, and obtaining regulatory approvals related to those product candidates, and manufacturing, marketing, and selling those
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">

	Table of Contents

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	products for which regulatory approvals are obtained.&nbsp;&nbsp;We or our partners may not succeed in these activities, and, as a result, we may never generate revenue that is sufficient to be profitable in the future.&nbsp;&nbsp;We will not be entitled to receive any royalty payments with respect to sales of Namzaric until May&nbsp;2020 and Namenda XR until June&nbsp;2018.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Even if we attain profitability, we may not be able to sustain or increase profitability on a quarterly or annual basis.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our failure to achieve or sustain profitability would cause cash generated from operations to be inadequate to fund future operations and could depress the value of our stock and impair our ability to raise capital, expand our business, diversify our product candidates, market our product candidates, if approved, or continue our operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our operating results may fluctuate significantly, which makes our future operating results difficult to predict and could cause our operating results to fall below expectations or our guidance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our quarterly and annual operating results may fluctuate significantly in the future, which makes it difficult for us to predict our future operating results.&nbsp;&nbsp;We received our final milestone payment under our license agreement with Forest in 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Any future revenue will depend on the establishment of potential future collaboration and license agreements, if any, and the achievement of any upfront or milestone payments provided thereunder and sales of our product candidates, if approved.&nbsp;&nbsp;Accordingly, upfront and milestone payments may vary significantly from period to period, and any such variance could cause a significant fluctuation in our operating results from one period to the next.&nbsp;&nbsp;Furthermore, our operating results may fluctuate due to a variety of other factors, many of which are outside of our control and may be difficult to predict, including:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the level of demand for our products, should any of our product candidates receive regulatory approval, which may vary significantly as they are launched and compete for position in the marketplace;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The cumulative effects of these factors could result in large fluctuations and unpredictability in our quarterly and annual operating results.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, comparing our operating results on a period-to-period basis may not be meaningful.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Investors should not rely on our past results as an indication of our future performance.&nbsp;&nbsp;This variability and unpredictability could also result in our failing to meet the expectations of industry or financial analysts or investors for any period.&nbsp;&nbsp;If our operating results fall below the expectations of analysts or investors or below any forecasts we may provide to the market, or if the forecasts we provide to the market are below the expectations of analysts or investors, the price of our common stock could decline substantially.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such a stock price decline could occur even when we have met any previously publicly stated operating results and/or earnings guidance that we may provide
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We may need additional funds and, if we cannot raise additional capital when needed, we may have to curtail or cease operations.
</FONT>
</P>

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the emergence of competing therapeutic approaches or other adverse market developments.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 11PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We do not have any committed external source of funds or other support for our development efforts other than our license agreement with Forest, which may be terminated by Forest upon delivery of notice.&nbsp;&nbsp;Until we can generate sufficient revenue from our own products and from royalties paid to us by Forest pursuant to our license agreement to finance our operations, which we may never do, we expect to finance future cash needs through a combination of public or private equity offerings, debt financings, collaborations, strategic alliances, licensing arrangements, asset sales, and other marketing and distribution arrangements.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional financing may not be available to us when we need it or it may not be available on favorable terms.&nbsp;&nbsp;If we raise additional capital through collaborations, strategic alliances, or licensing arrangements with third parties, we may have to relinquish certain valuable rights to our product candidates, technologies, future revenue streams, or research programs or grant licenses on terms that may not be favorable to us.&nbsp;&nbsp;If we raise additional capital through equity offerings, the ownership interest of our existing stockholders will be diluted, and the terms of these securities may include liquidation or other preferences that adversely affect our stockholders&#x2019; rights.&nbsp;&nbsp;If we raise additional capital through debt financing, we may be subject to covenants limiting or restricting our ability to take specific actions, such as incurring additional debt, making capital expenditures or declaring dividends.&nbsp;&nbsp;If we are unable to obtain adequate financing when needed, we may have to delay, reduce the scope of, or suspend one or more of our clinical studies or research and development programs or our commercialization efforts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Risks related to the development and commercialization of our current and future products
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our success depends heavily on the approval and successful commercialization of ADS-5102 as well as the successful U.S. commercialization by Forest of Namzaric and Namenda XR.&nbsp;&nbsp;If we are unable to successfully commercialize ADS-5102 or Forest is unable to successfully commercialize Namzaric and Namenda XR in the U.S., or if either we or Forest experience significant delays in doing so, our business will be materially harmed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have invested a significant portion of our efforts and financial resources into the development of ADS-5102, an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	oral once
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	daily controlled-release version of the FDA-approved drug amantadine, and Namzaric, a fixed-dose combination of the FDA-approved drugs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	memantine and donepezil.&nbsp;&nbsp;Namzaric has been exclusively licensed to Forest in the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, we have granted Forest a royalty-bearing license under certain of our patents to commercialize Namenda XR, a controlled-release version of memantine, in the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our ability to generate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	29
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	product and royalty revenue will depend heavily on the successful development, regulatory approval and eventual commercialization of ADS-5102 and successful commercialization of Namzaric and Namenda XR.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the terms of our license agreement with Forest, we will not be entitled to receive royalty payments on the sale of Namzaric until May&nbsp;2020 and Namenda XR until June&nbsp;2018.&nbsp;&nbsp;The success of these drugs and drug candidates will depend on numerous factors, including:

	any approved products continuing to have an acceptable safety profile following approval; and
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	obtaining, maintaining, enforcing, and defending intellectual property rights and claims.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	If we or Forest do not achieve one or more of these factors in a timely manner or at all, we could experience significant delays or an inability to successfully commercialize our product candidates, which would materially harm our business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Forest&#x2019;s ability to successfully commercialize Namzaric and Namenda XR will depend in part on its ability to transition patients currently being prescribed the immediate-release version of memantine, known as Namenda IR, to Namenda XR and subsequently or directly to Namzaric.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ther factors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, including the availability of generic memantine, may
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	negatively impact Forest&#x2019;s ability to successfully commercialize Namzaric and Namenda XR, our future royalty income could be materially adversely affected
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ADS-5102 is our only product candidate in clinical trials.&nbsp;&nbsp;We cannot give any assurance that the Phase&nbsp;3 clinical program for LID or development program for any of our product candidates will be successful or completed in a timely or effective manner.&nbsp;&nbsp;If clinical studies of ADS-5102 or our other product candidates fail to demonstrate sufficient safety and efficacy to the satisfaction of the FDA or similar regulatory authorities outside the United States or do not otherwise produce positive results, we may incur additional costs or experience delays in completing, or ultimately be unable to complete, the development and commercialization of our product candidates.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our failure to successfully complete our Phase&nbsp;3 program for ADS-5102, or otherwise adequately demonstrate the safety and effectiveness of this product candidate or our other product candidates will prevent us from receiving regulatory approval and would have a material and adverse impact on our business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ADS-5102 is our only product candidate in clinical trials.&nbsp;&nbsp;Before obtaining regulatory approval for the sale of our product candidates in any targeted indication, we must conduct extensive clinical studies and in some instances, extensive preclinical testing, including in certain indications, reproductive toxicology and carcinogenicity studies, to demonstrate the safety and efficacy of our product candidates in humans.&nbsp;&nbsp;Preclinical and clinical studies are expensive, are difficult to design and implement, can take many years to complete and are uncertain as to outcome.&nbsp;&nbsp;A failure of one or more of our preclinical or clinical studies could occur at any stage of testing.&nbsp;&nbsp;The outcome of preclinical testing and early clinical studies may not be predictive of the success of later preclinical or clinical studies, and interim results of a clinical study do not necessarily predict final
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	results.&nbsp;&nbsp;For example, the successful results of our Phase&nbsp;2/3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EASED
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	study
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and Phase 3 EASE LID study
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of ADS-5102 for the treatment of LID may not be confirmed in our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	remaining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Phase 3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
