<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	February 18, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	last reported sale price of our common stock as reported on The NASDAQ Global
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Market was $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	14.77
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	February 18, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	21,417,219
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of our common stock issued and outstanding with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	38
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	holders of record of our common stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The actual number of stockholders is greater than this number of record holders, and includes stockholders who are beneficial owners, but whose shares are held in street name by brokers and other nominees.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This number of holders of record also does not include stockholders whose shares may be held in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	trust by other entities.
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	STOCK PRICE PERFORMANCE GRAPH
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The following stock performance graph compares our total stock return with the total return for (i)&nbsp;the NASDAQ Composite Index and the (ii)&nbsp;the NASDAQ Biotechnology Index for the period from April&nbsp;10, 2014 (the date our common stock commenced trading on the NASDAQ Global Market) through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The figures represented below assume an investment of $100 in our common stock at the closing price of $14.01 on April&nbsp;10, 2014 and in the NASDAQ Composite Index and the NASDAQ Biotechnology Index on April&nbsp;10, 2014 and the reinvestment of dividends into shares of common stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The comparisons in the table are required by the Securities and Exchange Commission, or SEC, and are not intended to forecast or be indicative of possible future performance of our common stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This graph shall not be deemed &#x201C;soliciting material&#x201D; or be deemed &#x201C;filed&#x201D; for purposes of Section&nbsp;18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, or the Exchange Act, or otherwise subject to the liabilities under that Section, and shall not be deemed to be incorporated by reference into any of our filings under the Securities Act of 1933,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	as amended, or the Securities Act, whether made before or after the date hereof and irrespective of any general
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	incorporation language in any such filing.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/02/23/0001558370-16-003389_ADMS20151231X10K007.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 4.06346IN; HEIGHT: 2.455666IN" ALT="PICTURE 2">
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_8"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	DIVIDEND POLICY
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have never declared or paid, and do not anticipate declaring, or paying in the foreseeable future, any cash dividends on our capital stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Future determination as to the declaration and payment of dividends, if any, will be at the discretion of our board of directors and will depend on then existing conditions, including our operating results, financial conditions, contractual restrictions, capital requirements, business prospects and other factors our board of directors may deem relevant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	USE OF PROCEEDS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On April&nbsp;15, 2014, we issued and sold 3,000,000 shares of our common stock in the IPO at a public offering price of $16.00 per share, for net proceeds of approximately $41.4 million, after deducting underwriting discounts and commissions of approximately $3.4 million and expenses of approximately $3.2 million.&nbsp; On May&nbsp;6, 2014, we issued and sold 81,371 shares of common stock pursuant to the underwriters&#x2019; partial exercise of their option to purchase additional shares, for net proceeds of approximately $1.2 million, after deducting underwriting discounts and commissions of approximately $91,000.&nbsp; All of the shares issued and sold in the IPO were registered under the Securities Act pursuant to a Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;S-1 (File No.&nbsp;333-194342), which was declared effective by the SEC on April&nbsp;9, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	None of the expenses associated with the IPO were paid to directors, officers, persons owning 10% or more of

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	To date, substantially all of our revenue has been generated from our collaboration agreements, and we have not
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	generated any commercial product revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revenue in the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2014, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	includes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	recognition of revenue relating to upfront and milestone payments called for within our license agreement with Forest, effective November 13, 2012, of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$55.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, $69.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and $35.4 million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	See the section of this report entitled &#x201C;Management&#x2019;s discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations&#x2014;Financial operations overview&#x2014;Revenue&#x201D; for a more detailed description of our revenue recognition with respect to these agreements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.20%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:07.02%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

</DIV>
	19,149
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.66%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 46.8PT;TEXT-INDENT: -46.8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 7.&nbsp;&nbsp;MANAGEMENT&#x2019;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</FONT>
<A NAME="ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM7_MANAGEMENT_DISCUSSION">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	You should read the following discussion and analysis of our financial condition and results of operations together with the section of this report entitled &#x201C;Selected financial data&#x201D; and our financial statements and related notes included elsewhere in this report.&nbsp;&nbsp;This discussion and other parts of this report contain forward-looking statements that involve risk and uncertainties, such as statements of our plans, objectives, expectations and intentions.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our actual results could differ materially from those discussed in these forward-looking statements.&nbsp;&nbsp;Factors that could cause or contribute to such differences include, but are not limited to, those discussed in the section of this report entitled &#x201C;Risk factors.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are a pharmaceutical company focused on the development and commercialization of therapeutics targeting chronic disorders of the central nervous system (&#x201C;CNS&#x201D;).&nbsp;&nbsp;We seek to achieve this by enhancing the pharmacokinetic profiles of approved drugs to create novel therapeutics for use alone and in fixed-dose combination products.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our business strategy is twofold.&nbsp;&nbsp;We intend to develop and commercialize our wholly-owned products directly.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, we may form partnerships with companies that have an already established CNS market presence.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are developing our lead wholly-owned product candidate, ADS-5102 (amantadine hydrochloride), for multiple indications, including: a complication associated with the treatment of Parkinson&#x2019;s disease known as levodopa-induced dyskinesia (&#x201C;LID&#x201D;), for major symptoms associated with multiple sclerosis in patients with walking impairment, and potentially as a treatment for one or more additional CNS indications.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ADS-5102 is an extended-release version of amantadine that is intended for once daily administration at bedtime.&nbsp;&nbsp;ADS-5102 is designed to improve upon the pharmacokinetic profile of immediate-release amantadine, with the aim of enhancing efficacy without compromising the known tolerability profile.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	After successful completion of a Phase 2/3 clinical study in LID in 2013,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we initiated two confirmatory Phase 3 trials and a separate open-label safety study in 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;We completed enrollment in the larger of these trials, EASE LID, in July 2015, and the smaller, EASE LID 3, in December 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;We announced top-line results of EASE LID in December 2015 and expect to announce top-line results of EASE LID 3 in the first half of 2016.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We expect to submit a New Drug Application (&#x201C;NDA&#x201D;) to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (&#x201C;FDA&#x201D;) for ADS-5102 for the treatment of LID in 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are also exploring the utility of ADS-5102 for the treatment of major symptoms associated with multiple sclerosis in patients with walking impairment with the initiation of a Phase 2 clinical study in June&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We anticipate results from this study in 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;We may also explore the development of ADS-5102 in additional indications, as well as in combinations with other drugs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We have also commenced development of ADS-4101, an extended-release version of an FDA-approved single-agent compound for the treatment of epilepsy (partial onset seizures).&nbsp;&nbsp;We expect that this new program will progress into clinical trials in 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We plan to commercialize ADS-5102, and potentially other wholly-owned product candidates, if approved, by developing a small CNS commercial organization, including a sales force to reach
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	leading
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	neurologists and movement disorder specialists in the United States, and in other markets through distribution agreements and collaborations with CNS-focused pharmaceutical companies.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Through a partnership with Forest Laboratories Holdings Limited (&#x201C;Forest Laboratories&#x201D;), an indirect wholly-owned subsidiary of Allergan plc, our portfolio includes two drugs commercially available in the United States: Namzaric&#x2122; (memantine hydrochloride extended-release and donepezil hydrochloride) (formerly MDX-8704) and Namenda XR
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6.5PT;">
	&#xAE; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(memantine hydrochloride) extended release capsules, launched in May&nbsp;2015 and June&nbsp;2013, respectively
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	61
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Financial operations overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Summary
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our revenue to date has been generated primarily from license, milestone, and development revenue pursuant to our license agreement with Forest.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have not generated any commercial product revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we had an accumulated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	deficit of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	62.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Although we reported net income in each of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, 2013, and 2012, this was primarily due to the recognition of revenue pursuant to our license agreement with Forest.&nbsp;&nbsp;There are no further milestone payments to be earned under our license agreement with Forest.&nbsp;&nbsp;We cannot assure you that we will receive additional collaboration revenue in the future.&nbsp;&nbsp;We incurred significant losses in 2015 and prior to 2012 and expect to incur significant and increasing losses in the foreseeable future as we advance our product candidates into later stages of development and, if approved, commercialization
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Under our agreement with Forest, we received a non-refundable upfront license fee of $65.0&nbsp;million in 2012, which we recognized on a straight-line basis from November&nbsp;2012 to February&nbsp;2013, $40.0&nbsp;million in development milestone fees recognized in 2013, a $25.0 million milestone payment related to FDA acceptance of Forest&#x2019;s New Drug Application, or NDA, submission for Namzaric recognized in May&nbsp;2014, and a final $30.0&nbsp;million milestone payment recognized in December&nbsp;2014 upon FDA approval of the NDA.&nbsp;&nbsp;Beginning five years after the May&nbsp;2015 commercial launch we are entitled to receive tiered royalties in the low double digits to the mid-teens for sales of Namzaric in the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, we are also entitled to receive tiered royalties in the low to mid-single digits from Forest for sales of Namenda XR in the United States beginning in June&nbsp;2018, however, we do not expect the Namenda XR royalties will make a significant financial contribution to our business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We expect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to continue to incur significant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	research and development expenses as we continue to advance our product candidates through clinical development.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, we plan to commercialize ADS-5102, if approved, and potentially other wholly-owned product candidates by developing a CNS commercial organization, including a sales force to reach
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	leading
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	neurologists and movement disorder specialists in the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;Because of the numerous risks and uncertainties associated with drug development, we are unable to predict the timing or amount of expenses incurred or when, or if, we will be able to achieve sustained profitability
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Prior to our initial public offering of our common stock, or IPO, in April&nbsp;2014, we had raised an aggregate of approximately $87.2&nbsp;million through the sale of convertible preferred stock and $1.0 million through the exercise of preferred stock warrants.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2014, we issued and sold 3,081,371 shares of common stock in our IPO and received net proceeds of approximately $42.6 million, which included partial exercise of the underwriters&#x2019; option to purchase additional shares and after deducting underwriting discounts, commissions and offering expenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the completion of our IPO, all convertible preferred stock converted into common stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;On June&nbsp;1, 2015, we entered into a Controlled Equity Offering Sales Agreement, pursuant to which we may, from time to time, issue and sell shares of common stock having an aggregate offering value of up to $25.0 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we had issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	509,741
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock and raised net proceeds of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	9.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million under the Sales Agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we had cash, cash equivalents, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	investments of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	120.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In January 2016, we raised an additional $61.8 million from the sale of 2,875,000 shares of common stock.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have not generated any revenue from commercial product sales to date.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our revenue to date has been generated primarily from non-refundable upfront license payments, milestone payments, and reimbursements for research and development expenses under our license agreement with Forest and to a lesser degree from NIH grants and government contracts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">

</P>

	62

<P STYLE="MARGIN:8PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	recognized collaboration revenue of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	zero
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	55.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively, pursuant to our license agreement with Forest.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We also recognized revenue from Forest of approximately $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million in development funding for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We do not expect to recognize any further milestone payments under our license agreement with Forest, while development funding is expected to remain at modest levels in future periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;Beginning in May&nbsp;2020, we will be entitled to receive royalties in the low double digits to the mid-teens from Forest for sales of Namzaric in the United States and in June&nbsp;2018, we will be entitled to receive royalties in the low to mid-single digits for sales of Namenda XR in the United States.&nbsp;&nbsp;We were also awarded a continuation of an NIH grant for $1.0 million in August&nbsp;2014, which we will administer, but conduct through subcontractors.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Research and development expenses
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Research and development expenses represent costs incurred to conduct research, such as the discovery and development of our wholly-owned product candidates, as well as the development of product candidates pursuant to our agreement with Forest.&nbsp;&nbsp;We recognize all research and development costs as they are incurred.&nbsp;&nbsp;We began tracking our external costs by project beginning January&nbsp;1, 2006.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Research and development expenses consist of:
</FONT>
</P>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	fees paid to clinical consultants, clinical trial sites, and vendors, including clinical research organizations, or CROs, in conjunction with implementing and monitoring our clinical trials and acquiring and evaluating clinical trial data, including all related fees, such as for investigator grants, patient screening fees, laboratory work, and statistical compilation and analysis;
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	63
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The program-specific expenses summarized in the table above include costs directly attributable to our product candidates.&nbsp;&nbsp;We allocate research and development salaries, benefits, stock-based compensation, and indirect costs to our product candidates on a program-specific basis, and we include these costs in the program-specific expenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have reallocated certain other research and development expenses to program
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;specific expenses for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 in order to consistently classify our product candidate expenses between periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The largest component of our total operating expenses has historically been our investment in research and development activities, including the clinical development of our product candidates.&nbsp;&nbsp;We anticipate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to continue to incur significant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	research and development expenses as we continue our clinical trials for ADS-5102 in LID and major symptoms associated with MS, ADS-4101 for treatment of epilepsy, and potentially initiate additional clinical-stage programs in more indications or for future product candidates.&nbsp;&nbsp;The process of conducting the necessary clinical research to obtain FDA approval is costly and time consuming.&nbsp;&nbsp;We consider the active management and development of our clinical pipeline to be crucial to our long-term success.&nbsp;&nbsp;The actual probability of success for each product candidate and clinical program may be affected by a variety of factors including but not limited to the quality of the product candidate, early clinical data, investment in the program, competition, manufacturing capability, and commercial viability.&nbsp;&nbsp;Furthermore, in the past we have entered into collaborations with other pharmaceutical companies, CROs, and academic third parties to participate in the development and commercialization of our product candidates, and we may enter into additional collaborations in the future.&nbsp;&nbsp;In situations in which third parties have control over the clinical development of a product candidate, the estimated completion dates are largely under the control of such third parties and not under our control.&nbsp;&nbsp;We cannot forecast with any degree of certainty which of our product candidates, if any, will be subject to future collaborations or how such arrangements would affect our development plans or capital requirements.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result of the uncertainties discussed above, we are unable to determine the duration and completion costs of our research and development projects or when and to what extent we will generate revenue from the commercialization and sale of any of our product candidates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	General and administrative expenses
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	General and administrative expenses consist primarily of personnel and related benefit costs, and facilities, professional services, insurance, and public company related expenses.&nbsp;&nbsp;We anticipate our general and administrative expenses will increase as we continue to support our clinical and potentially commercial-stage programs.&nbsp;&nbsp;If ADS-5102 or other products are approved by the FDA, we plan to market and sell through our own sales force to reach
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	leading
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	neurologists and movement disorder specialists in the United States, which will further increase general and administrative expenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Interest and other income (expense), net
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Interest and other income (expense), net consists primarily of interest received on our cash, cash equivalents, and short and long-term investments, as well as gains and losses resulting from the remeasurement of our convertible preferred stock warrant liability.&nbsp;&nbsp;We recorded adjustments to the estimated fair value of the convertible preferred stock warrants until they were exercised or expired.&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsequent to the IPO, we reclassified the convertible preferred stock warrant liability as additional paid-in capital and we no longer recorded any related periodic fair value adjustments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Critical accounting policies and significant judgments and estimates
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our management&#x2019;s discussion and analysis of our financial condition and results of operations is based on our financial statements, which have been prepared in accordance with United States generally accepted accounting principles, or U.S. GAAP.&nbsp;&nbsp;The preparation of these financial statements requires us to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements, as well as the reported revenue generated and expenses incurred during the reporting periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our estimates are based on our historical experience and on various other factors that we believe are reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	making judgments about the carrying value of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other sources
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have discussed the development, selection and disclosure of these estimates with the Audit Committee of our Board of Directors.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Actual results may differ from these estimates under different assumptions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	While our significant accounting policies are described in more detail in Note&nbsp;2 of our financial statements included in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;K, we believe the following accounting policies to be critical to the judgments and estimates used in the preparation of our financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	64
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We recognize revenue when all four of the following criteria have been met: (i)&nbsp;persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, (ii)&nbsp;delivery has occurred or services have been rendered, (iii)&nbsp;the fee is fixed or determinable and (iv)&nbsp;collectability is reasonably assured.&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenue under license and collaboration arrangements is recognized based on the performance requirements of the contract.&nbsp;&nbsp;Determinations of whether persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists and whether delivery has occurred or services have been rendered are based on management&#x2019;s judgments regarding the fixed nature of the fees charged for deliverables and the collectability of those fees.&nbsp;&nbsp;Should changes in conditions cause management to determine that these criteria are not met for any new or modified transactions, revenue recognized could be adversely affected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We generate revenue from collaboration and license agreements for the development and commercialization of products.&nbsp;&nbsp;Collaboration and license agreements may include non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;refundable upfront license fees, partial or complete reimbursement of research and development costs, contingent consideration payments based on the achievement of defined collaboration objectives and royalties on sales of commercialized products.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s performance obligations under the collaborations may include the license or transfer of intellectual property rights, obligations to provide research and development services and related materials and obligations to participate on certain development
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and/or commercialization committees with the collaborators.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	For revenue agreements with multiple-element arrangements, we allocate revenue to each non-contingent element based on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the relative
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;selling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;price
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of each element
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in an arrangement.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	When applying the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	relative
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;selling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;price method
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we determine the selling price for each deliverable using the following estimation hierarchy
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	: (i)&nbsp;vendor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;specific objective evidence of fair value of the deliverable, if it exists, (ii)&nbsp;third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;party evidence of selling price, if vendor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;specific objective evidence is not available or (iii)&nbsp;vendor&#x2019;s best estimate of selling price, if neither vendor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;specific nor third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;party evidence is available.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Revenue allocated is then recognized when the four basic revenue recognition criteria, mentioned above, are met for each element
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We recognize p
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ayments that are contingent upon achievement of a substantive milestone in their entirety in the period in which the milestone is achieved.&nbsp;&nbsp;Milestones are defined as events that can only be achieved based on the Company&#x2019;s performance and there is substantive uncertainty about whether the event will be achieved at the inception of the arrangement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Events that are contingent only on the passage of time or only on counterparty performance are not considered milestones subject to this guidance.&nbsp;&nbsp;Further, the amounts received must relate solely to prior performance, be reasonable relative to all of the deliverables and payment terms within the agreement and commensurate with our performance to achieve the milestone after commencement of the agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Amounts related to research and development funding are recognized as the related services or activities are performed, in accordance with the contract terms.&nbsp;&nbsp;Payments may be made to or by us based on the number of full
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;time equivalent researchers assigned to the collaboration project and the related research and development expenses incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;Based Compensation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We account for stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation of stock options granted to employees and directors and for employee stock purchase plan shares by estimating the fair value of stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based awards using the Black
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Scholes option
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;pricing model and amortizing the fair value of the stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based awards granted over the applicable vesting period.&nbsp;&nbsp;All stock options awards to non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;employees are accounted for at the fair value of the consideration received or the fair value of the equity instrument issued, as calculated using the Black
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Scholes model.&nbsp;&nbsp;The measurement of non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	employee stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation is subject to periodic adjustment as the underlying equity instruments vest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In order to estimate the value of share
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based awards, we use the Black
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Scholes model, which requires the use of certain subjective assumptions.&nbsp;&nbsp;The most significant subjective assumptions are management&#x2019;s estimates of the expected volatility and the expected term of the award.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, judgment is also required in estimating the amount of share
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based awards that are expected to be forfeited.&nbsp;&nbsp;If actual results differ significantly from any of these estimates, stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation expense and our results of operations could be materially impacted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Clinical Trial Accruals
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our clinical trial accruals are based on estimates of patient enrollment and related costs at clinical investigator sites, as well as estimates for the services received and efforts expended pursuant to contracts with multiple research institutions and clinical research organizations (&#x201C;CROs&#x201D;) that conduct and manage clinical trials on our behalf.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	65
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We estimate clinical trial expenses based on the services performed pursuant to contracts with research institutions and clinical research organizations that conduct and manage clinical trials on our behalf.&nbsp;&nbsp;In accruing service fees, we obtain the reported level of patient enrollment at each site and estimate the time period over which services will be performed and activity expended in each period.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the actual timing of the performance of services or the level of effort varies from the estimate, we will adjust the accrual accordingly.&nbsp;&nbsp;Payments made to third parties under these arrangements in advance of the receipt of the related services are recorded as prepaid expenses until the services are rendered
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Results of operations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Comparison of the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The following table summarizes our results of operations for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2014

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(in thousands, except percentages):
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Increase/
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.68%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:10.48%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	%&nbsp;Increase/
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.72%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>

	&#8209;5102, which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	increased by $

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	11.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

</FONT>

	32.2

</FONT>

	21.1

	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2014

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of clinical supplies, increased headcount, as well as continued enrollment in our Phase&nbsp;3 program in support of ADS-5102 for LID and our Phase 2 trial for the treatment of major symptoms associated with MS.&nbsp;&nbsp;There were also

	increased

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	investments.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the year ended December 31, 2014 we recorded other expense, primarily attributed to

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the remeasurement of
</FONT>

	f the change in fair value.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 11PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Comparison of the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	December 31, 2014

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	2013
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 11PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The following table summarizes our results of operations for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2014
</FONT>

	and

	2013

	(in thousands, except percentages):

	0.3

	million for the years ended December 31,

	2014

	&nbsp;a

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	nd
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;The increase in research and development expenses related primarily to manufacturing of clinical supplies, commencement, and continued enrollment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our Phase 3 trials in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	support of ADS-5102 for LID, which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	increased
</FONT>

	&nbsp;$

	16.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million, or

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	369%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, to $
</FONT>

	21.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million

	from $

	4.5

	1
</FONT>

	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million in 2014 over the prior year period, which were mostly comprised of consultant expenses.&nbsp;&nbsp;There was a partially offsetting decrease in expenses of $2.2 million to $0.2 million from $2.4 million for year years ended

	and 2013, respectively, for ADS-8704, which we incurred as part of our licensing agreement with Forest.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	2013

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	sales of our common stock in public offerings, including $41.4 million in our April 2014 IPO.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On June&nbsp;1, 2015, we entered into a Controlled Equity Offering Sales Agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Cantor Fitzgerald &amp; Co.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, pursuant to which we may, from time to time, issue and sell shares of common stock having an aggregate offering value of up to $25.0 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we had issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	509,741
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock and raised net proceeds of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	9.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million under the Sales Agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have not generated any revenue from the sale of products.&nbsp;&nbsp;We incurred losses and generated negative cash flows from operations since inception through the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011.&nbsp;&nbsp;Although in 2014, 2013, and 2012, we recognized a profit and positive cash flow as a result of payments received pursuant to our license agreement with Forest, we received our final milestone payment from Forest in December 2014, and we do not currently receive any royalties from Forest, nor do we have other collaborations from which we might expect milestone or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	royalty revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Consequently, we expect to incur substantial and increasing losses for the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our principal sources of liquidity were our cash, cash equivalents
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and investments, which totaled $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	120.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	158.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectivel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	y.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On January 6, 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	01
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	6, the Company completed a follow-on public offering of 2,875,000 shares of its common stock, which includes the exercise in full by the underwriters of their option to purchase 375,000 shares of common stock, at an offering price of $23.00 per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;Proceeds from the follow-on public offering were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	approximately $6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million, net of underwriting discounts, commissions,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and offering-related transaction costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We believe our existing cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	cash equivalents
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, and investments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	will be sufficient to fund our projected operating requirements, including operations related to the continued development of ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 for LID, for at least the next 12&nbsp;months.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, it is possible that we will not achieve the progress that we expect, because the actual costs and timing of drug development, particularly clinical studies, and regulatory app
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	rovals
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	are difficult to predict, subject to substantial risks and delays, and often vary depending on the particular indication and development strategy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We expect to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	continue significant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	spending in connection with the development and commercialization of our product candidates, particularly for ADS-5102 for LID, as well as other indications.&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to continue these activities, we may decide to raise additional funds through a combination of equity offerings, debt financings, collaborations, and other strategic alliances.&nbsp;&nbsp;Sufficient additional funding may not be available on acceptable terms, or at all.&nbsp;&nbsp;If adequate funds are not available in the future, we may need to delay, reduce the scope of, or put on hold our clinical studies, research and development programs, or commercialization efforts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Net cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	provided by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	operating activities was $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	26.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	compared to $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	26.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In 2014, we received development
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	milestone payments of $55.0&nbsp;million under our license agreement with Forest.&nbsp;&nbsp;Net income of $10.2 million for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	net non-cash adjustments of $5.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million, which consisted primarily of stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation of $7.2&nbsp;million and a change in the preferred stock warrant value of $1.0&nbsp;million, offset by an excess tax benefit on the exercise of stock options of $1.6&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and net investment premium of $1.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, operating cash was generated primarily through the receipt of $40.0&nbsp;million in development milestone payments under our license agreement with Forest.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Net income of $50.9&nbsp;million for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the year ended December 31, 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	included non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;cash income of $29.6&nbsp;million of deferred revenue and non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;cash charges of $4.5&nbsp;million related to the change in the value of the preferred stock warrant and $0.6&nbsp;million in stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The primary use of cash was to fund the ongoing clinical studies and product development activities related to ADS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5102 for LID.
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:8PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Recent Accounting Pronouncements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In May 2014, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update (&#x201C;ASU&#x201D;) 2014-09,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The amendment in this ASU provides guidance on the revenue recognition to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services.&nbsp;&nbsp;The core principle of this update provides guidance to identify the performance obligations under the contract(s) with a customer and how to allocate the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract.&nbsp;&nbsp;It further provides guidance to recognize revenue when (or as) the entity satisfies a performance obligation.&nbsp;&nbsp;This standard will replace most existing revenue recognition guidance.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On July&nbsp;9, 2015, the FASB approved a one-year deferral of the effective date of this standard to 2018 for public companies, with an option that would permit companies to adopt the standard as early as the original effective date of 2017.&nbsp;&nbsp;Early adoption prior to the original effective date is not permitted.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have not yet selected a transition method nor have we determined the effect of the standard on our consolidated financial position and results of operations.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In August 2014, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	FASB issued ASU
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2014-15,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Presentation of Financial Statements-Going Concern (Subtopic 205-40): Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;This ASU provides guidance on management&#x2019;s responsibility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in evaluating whether there is substantial doubt about a Company&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern and about related footnote disclosures.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	For each reporting period, management will be required to evaluate whether there are conditions or events that raise substantial doubt about the company&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern within one year from the date the financial statements are issued.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The amendments in this update are effective for annual periods ending after December&nbsp;15, 2016, and for interim periods within annual periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;Early adoption is permitted for annual or interim reporting periods for which the financial statements have not previously been issued.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are evaluating the impact the revised guidance will have on our financial statements.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	In November 2015, the FASB issued ASU No. 2015-17,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income Taxes (Topic 740): Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	. Under ASU 2015-17, a reporting entity is required to classify deferred tax assets and liabilities as noncurrent in a classified statement of financial position. Current guidance requiring the offsetting of deferred tax assets and liabilities of a tax-paying component of an entity and presentation as a single noncurrent amount is not affected. This ASU is effective for public business entities issuing financial statements for the annual periods beginning after December 15, 2016, and interim periods within those annual periods. Early adoption is permitted for financial statements as of the beginning of an interim or annual reporting period. Entities may apply the update prospectively to all deferred tax assets and liabilities and taxes, or retrospectively for all periods presented. The effects of this update on our consolidated financial statements are not expected to be material.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	JOBS Act Accounting Election
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are an &#x201C;emerging growth company,&#x201D; as defined in the Jumpstart Our Business Startups Act of 2012, or the JOBS Act.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the JOBS Act, emerging growth companies can delay adopting new or revised accounting standards issued subsequent to the enactment of the JOBS Act until such time as those standards apply to private companies.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have irrevocably elected not to avail ourselves of this exemption from new or revised accounting standards, and, therefore, are subject to the same new or revised accounting standards as other public companies that are not emerging growth companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	70
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 7A.&nbsp;&nbsp;QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK
</FONT>
<A NAME="ADMS-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM_7A_QUANTITATIVE_AND_QUALITATIVE">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The primary objective of our investment activities is to preserve our capital to fund our operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;We also seek to maximize income from our investments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	without assuming significant risk.&nbsp;&nbsp;To achieve our objectives, we maintain a portfolio of cash equivalents and investments in a variety of securities of high credit quality.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we had cash, cash equivalents, and investments of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	120.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	consisting of cash and cash equivalents, as well as short and long-term investment grade available-for-sale securi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ties.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In January 2016, we raised an additional $61.8 million from the sale of 2,875,000 shares of common stock.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	A portion of our investments may be subject to interest rate risk and could fall in value if market interest rates increase.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, because our investments are primarily short-term in duration and our holdings in US government bonds and corporate debt securities mature prior to our expected need for liquidity, we believe that our exposure to interest rate risk is not significant and, as a consequence, a 1% movement in market interest rates would not have a significant impact on the total value of our portfolio.&nbsp;&nbsp;We actively monitor changes in interest rates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<EFX_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS"></A>

	The Consolidated Financial Statements and Supplementary Data required by this Item are set forth where indicated in Item&nbsp;15 of this report.
